[Lucy]116-lucy felt that [she]116-lucy had been selfish . " No , no . [You]116-lucy must have it . "[116-lucy]

" [She]2095-your mother would never forgive [me]116-lucy . "[116-lucy]

[The ladies]302-the ladies ' voices grew animated , and -- if the sad truth be owned -- a little peevish . [They]302-the ladies were tired , and under the guise of unselfishness [they]302-the ladies wrangled . [Some of [[their]302-the ladies neighbours]304-their neighbours]303-some of their neighbours interchanged glances , and [one of [them]303-some of their neighbours]305-one of them -- one of [the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad]306-the ill - bred people whom one does meet abroad -- leant forward over the table and actually intruded into [their]302-the ladies argument . [He]305-one of them said :

" [I]305-one of them have a view , [I]305-one of them have a view . "[305-one of them]

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was startled . Generally at [a pension]307-a pension [people]308-people looked [them]308-people over for a day or two before speaking , and often did not find out that [they]308-people would " do "[308-people] till [they]308-people had gone . [She]115-miss bartlett knew that [the intruder]309-the intruder was ill - bred , even before [she]115-miss bartlett glanced at [him]309-the intruder . [He]309-the intruder was [an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes]310-an old man , of heavy build , with a fair , shaven face and large eyes . There was something childish in those eyes , though it was not the childishness of senility . What exactly it was [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett did not stop to consider , for [her]115-miss bartlett glance passed on to [his]309-the intruder clothes . These did not attract [her]115-miss bartlett . [He]309-the intruder was probably trying to become acquainted with [them]311-them before [they]311-them got into [the swim]312-the swim . So [she]115-miss bartlett assumed a dazed expression when [he]309-the intruder spoke to [her]115-miss bartlett , and then said : " A view ? Oh , a view ! How delightful a view is ! "[115-miss bartlett]

[He]309-the intruder did not look at [the ladies]302-the ladies as [he]309-the intruder spoke , but [his]309-the intruder voice was perplexed and sorrowful . Now [the old man]313-the old man attacked [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett almost violently : Why should [she]115-miss bartlett not change ? What possible objection had [she]115-miss bartlett ? [They]302-the ladies would clear out in half an hour .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , though skilled in the delicacies of conversation , was powerless in the presence of brutality . It was impossible to snub [any one so gross]325-any one so gross . [Her]115-miss bartlett face reddened with displeasure . [She]115-miss bartlett looked around as much as to say , " Are [you]302-the ladies all like this ? "[115-miss bartlett]

Hardly had [she]116-lucy announced this fell decision when [she]116-lucy reversed it . [He]119-mr. beebe preferred to talk to [Lucy]116-lucy , whose playing [he]119-mr. beebe remembered , rather than to [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , who probably remembered [his]119-mr. beebe sermons . [He]119-mr. beebe asked [the girl]332-the girl whether [she]332-the girl knew [Florence]14-florence well , and was informed at some length that [she]332-the girl had never been [there]337-there before . " [That lady]2119-that lady looks so clever , "[115-miss bartlett] whispered [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett to [[her]115-miss bartlett cousin]317-her cousin . " [We]341-them are in luck . "[115-miss bartlett]

And , indeed , a perfect torrent of information burst on [them]341-them . [People]308-people told [them]341-them what to see , when to see it , how to stop [the electric trams]343-the electric trams , how to get rid of [the beggars]344-the beggars , how much to give for a vellum blotter , how much [the place]345-the place would grow upon [them]341-them . [The Pension Bertolini]113-the bertolini had decided , almost enthusiastically , that [they]341-them would do . Whichever way [they]341-them looked , [kind ladies]346-kind ladies smiled and shouted at [them]341-them . And above all rose the voice of [the clever lady]347-the clever lady , crying : " [Prato]9-prato ! [They]341-them must go to [Prato]9-prato . [That place]2120-that place is too sweetly squalid for words . [I]347-the clever lady love [it]2120-that place ; [I]347-the clever lady revel in shaking off the trammels of respectability , as [you]348-the young man know . "[347-the clever lady]

[The young man]348-the young man named [George]118-george glanced at [the clever lady]347-the clever lady , and then returned moodily to [his]348-the young man plate . Obviously [he]348-the young man and [[his]348-the young man father]350-his father did not do . [Lucy]116-lucy , in the midst of [her]116-lucy success , found time to wish [they]351-they did . It gave [her]116-lucy no extra pleasure that [any one]352-any one should be left in the cold ; and when [she]116-lucy rose to go , [she]116-lucy turned back and gave [the two outsiders]353-the two outsiders a nervous little bow .

[The father]354-the father did not see it ; [the son]320-the son acknowledged it , not by another bow , but by raising [his]320-the son eyebrows and smiling ; [he]320-the son seemed to be smiling across something .

[She]116-lucy hastened after [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin , who had already disappeared through the curtains -- curtains which smote one in the face , and seemed heavy with more than cloth . Beyond [them]351-they stood [the unreliable [Signora]114-the signora , bowing good - evening to [[her]114-the signora guests]358-her guests , and supported by ' [Enery]121-enery , [[her]114-the signora little boy]359-her little boy , and [Victorier]122-victorier , [[her]114-the signora daughter]360-her daughter]357-the unreliable signora , bowing good - evening to her guests , and supported by ' enery , her little boy , and victorier , her daughter . It made a curious little scene , this attempt of [the Cockney]123-the cockney to convey the grace and geniality of [the South]10-the south . And even more curious was [the drawing - room , which attempted to rival the solid comfort of [a Bloomsbury boarding - house]362-a bloomsbury boarding - house]361-the drawing - room , which attempted to rival the solid comfort of a bloomsbury boarding - house . Was this really [Italy]11-italy ?

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was already seated on a tightly stuffed arm - chair , which had the colour and the contours of a tomato . [She]115-miss bartlett was talking to [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , and as [she]115-miss bartlett spoke , [her]115-miss bartlett long narrow head drove backwards and forwards , slowly , regularly , as though [she]115-miss bartlett were demolishing some invisible obstacle . " [We]2121-we are most grateful to [you]119-mr. beebe , "[115-miss bartlett] [she]115-miss bartlett was saying . " The first evening means so much . When [you]119-mr. beebe arrived [we]2121-we were in for a peculiarly mauvais quart d'heure . "[115-miss bartlett]

[He]119-mr. beebe expressed [his]119-mr. beebe regret .

" Do [you]115-miss bartlett , by any chance , know the name of [an old man who sat opposite [us]2121-we at dinner]2122-an old man who sat opposite us at dinner ? "[115-miss bartlett]

" [Emerson]118-george . "[115-miss bartlett]

" Oh , dear ! "[375-the little old lady] breathed [the little old lady]375-the little old lady , and shuddered as if all the winds of heaven had entered [the apartment]396-the apartment . " [Gentlemen]2176-gentlemen sometimes do not realize-- "[375-the little old lady] [Her]375-the little old lady voice faded away , but [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett seemed to understand and a conversation developed , in which [gentlemen who did not thoroughly realize]397-gentlemen who did not thoroughly realize played a principal part . For [she]116-lucy was determined to enjoy [herself]116-lucy on the morrow . Thus the half - hour crept profitably away , and at last [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett rose with a sigh , and said :

" [I]115-miss bartlett think one might venture now . No , [Lucy]116-lucy , do not stir . [I]115-miss bartlett will superintend the move . "[115-miss bartlett]

[Charlotte]115-miss bartlett 's energy ! And [her]115-miss bartlett unselfishness ! [She]115-miss bartlett had been thus all [her]115-miss bartlett life , but really , on this Italian tour , [she]115-miss bartlett was surpassing [herself]115-miss bartlett . So [Lucy]116-lucy felt , or strove to feel . And yet -- there was a rebellious spirit in [her]115-miss bartlett which wondered whether the acceptance might not have been less delicate and more beautiful . At all events , [she]115-miss bartlett entered [[her]115-miss bartlett own room]398-her own room without any feeling of joy .

" [I]115-miss bartlett want to explain , "[115-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , " why it is that [I]115-miss bartlett have taken [the largest room]2179-the largest room . "[115-miss bartlett]

However , [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe is a guarantee of a sort that [they]2185-they will not presume on this . "[116-lucy]

" [Mother]127-mother would n't mind [I]116-lucy 'm sure , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , but again had the sense of larger and unsuspected issues .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett only sighed , and enveloped [her]116-lucy in a protecting embrace as [she]115-miss bartlett wished [her]116-lucy good - night . It gave [Lucy]116-lucy the sensation of a fog , and when [she]116-lucy reached [[her]116-lucy own room]398-her own room [she]116-lucy opened the window and breathed the clean night air , thinking of [the kind old man who had enabled [her]116-lucy to see the lights dancing in [the Arno]2-the arno and [the cypresses of [San Miniato]24-san miniato]401-the cypresses of san miniato , and [the foot - hills of [the Apennines]17-the apennines]402-the foot - hills of the apennines , black against the rising moon]400-the kind old man who had enabled her to see the lights dancing in the arno and the cypresses of san miniato , and the foot - hills of the apennines , black against the rising moon .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , in [[her]115-miss bartlett room]403-her room , fastened the window - shutters and locked the door , and then made a tour of [the apartment]396-the apartment to see where the cupboards led , and whether there were any oubliettes or secret entrances . It was then that [she]115-miss bartlett saw , pinned up over the washstand , a sheet of paper on which was scrawled an enormous note of interrogation . Nothing more .

" What does it mean ? "[115-miss bartlett] [she]115-miss bartlett thought , and [she]115-miss bartlett examined it carefully by the light of a candle . Meaningless at first , it gradually became menacing , obnoxious , portentous with evil . [She]115-miss bartlett was seized with an impulse to destroy it , but fortunately remembered that [she]115-miss bartlett had no right to do so , since it must be the property of [young Mr. Emerson]118-george . So [she]115-miss bartlett unpinned it carefully , and put it between two pieces of blotting - paper to keep it clean for [him]118-george . Then [she]115-miss bartlett completed [her]115-miss bartlett inspection of [the room]328-the room , sighed heavily according to [her]115-miss bartlett habit , and went to bed .

Chapter II : In [Santa Croce]18-santa croce with No Baedeker

It was pleasant to wake up in [Florence]14-florence , to open the eyes upon [a bright bare room]406-a bright bare room , with a floor of red tiles which look clean though they are not ; with a painted ceiling whereon pink griffins and blue amorini sport in a forest of yellow violins and bassoons . It was pleasant , too , to fling wide the windows , pinching the fingers in unfamiliar fastenings , to lean out into sunshine with beautiful hills and trees and [marble churches]407-marble churches opposite , and close below , [the Arno]2-the arno , gurgling against [the embankment of [the road]409-the road]408-the embankment of the road .

Over [the river]410-the river [men]2100-men were at work with spades and sieves on [the sandy foreshore]412-the sandy foreshore , and on [the river]410-the river was [a boat]414-a boat , also diligently employed for some mysterious end . [An electric tram]415-an electric tram came rushing underneath the window . [No one]2143-no one was inside [it]415-an electric tram , except [one tourist]417-one tourist ; but [[its]415-an electric tram platforms]418-its platforms were overflowing with [Italians , who preferred to stand]419-italians , who preferred to stand . [Children]420-children tried to hang on behind , and [the conductor]421-the conductor , with no malice , spat in [their]420-children faces to make [them]420-children let go . Then [soldiers]422-soldiers appeared -- good - looking , [undersized men]423-undersized men -- wearing each a knapsack covered with mangy fur , and a great - coat which had been cut for [some larger soldier]424-some larger soldier . Beside [them]422-soldiers walked [officers]425-officers , looking foolish and fierce , and before [them]422-soldiers went [little boys]426-little boys , turning somersaults in time with [the band]427-the band . [The tramcar]428-the tramcar became entangled in [their]422-soldiers ranks , and moved on painfully , like a caterpillar in a swarm of ants . [One of [the little boys]430-the little boys]429-one of the little boys fell down , and some white bullocks came out of an archway . Indeed , if it had not been for the good advice of [an old man who was selling button - hooks]431-an old man who was selling button - hooks , [the road]409-the road might never have got clear .

Over such trivialities as these many a valuable hour may slip away , and [the traveller who has gone to [Italy]11-italy to study the tactile values of [Giotto]140-giotto , or the corruption of [the Papacy]20-the papacy]433-the traveller who has gone to italy to study the tactile values of giotto , or the corruption of the papacy , may return remembering nothing but the blue sky and [the men]434-the men and [women who live under it]435-women who live under it . So it was as well that [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett should tap and come in , and having commented on [Lucy]116-lucy 's leaving the door unlocked , and on [her]116-lucy leaning out of the window before [she]116-lucy was fully dressed , should urge [her]116-lucy to hasten [herself]116-lucy , or the best of the day would be gone . By the time [Lucy]116-lucy was ready [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin had done [her]317-her cousin breakfast , and was listening to [the clever lady among the crumbs]437-the clever lady among the crumbs .

A conversation then ensued , on not unfamiliar lines . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was , after all , a wee bit tired , and thought [they]438-they had better spend the morning settling in ; unless [Lucy]116-lucy would at all like to go out ? [Lucy]116-lucy would rather like to go out , as it was [her]116-lucy first day in [Florence]14-florence , but , of course , [she]116-lucy could go alone . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett could not allow this . Of course [she]115-miss bartlett would accompany [Lucy]116-lucy everywhere . Oh , certainly not ; [Lucy]116-lucy would stop with [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin . Oh , no ! that would never do . Oh , yes !

At this point [the clever lady]347-the clever lady broke in .

" If it is [Mrs. Grundy]128-mrs. grundy who is troubling [you]116-lucy , [I]347-the clever lady do assure [you]116-lucy that [you]116-lucy can neglect [the good person]2186-the good person . Being English , [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy will be perfectly safe . [Italians]129-italians understand . [A dear friend of [mine]347-the clever lady]2187-a dear friend of mine , [Contessa Baroncelli]130-contessa baroncelli , has [two daughters]2188-two daughters , and when [she]130-contessa baroncelli can not send [a maid]2189-a maid to school with [them]2188-two daughters , [she]130-contessa baroncelli lets [them]2188-two daughters go in sailor - hats instead . [Every one]2190-every one takes [them]2188-two daughters for English , [you]116-lucy see , especially if [their]2188-two daughters hair is strained tightly behind . "[347-the clever lady]

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was unconvinced by the safety of [[Contessa Baroncelli]130-contessa baroncelli 's daughters]441-contessa baroncelli 's daughters . [She]115-miss bartlett was determined to take [Lucy]116-lucy [herself]116-lucy , [her]116-lucy head not being so very bad . " Remember , "[118-george] [he]118-george was saying , " the facts about [this church of [Santa Croce]18-santa croce]2253-this church of santa croce ; how [it]2253-this church of santa croce was built by faith in the full fervour of medievalism , before any taint of the Renaissance had appeared . Observe how [Giotto]140-giotto in these frescoes -- now , unhappily , ruined by restoration -- is untroubled by the snares of anatomy and perspective . Could anything be more majestic , more pathetic , beautiful , true ? How little , [we]2254-we feel , avails knowledge and technical cleverness against [a man who truly feels]2255-a man who truly feels ! "[118-george]

" No ! "[118-george] exclaimed [Mr. Emerson]118-george , in much too loud a voice for [church]532-church . " Remember nothing of the sort ! Built by faith indeed ! [He]118-george was referring to the fresco of the " Ascension of [St. John]144-st. john . "[118-george] Inside , [the lecturer]533-the lecturer 's voice faltered , as well it might . [She]116-lucy was sure that [she]116-lucy ought not to be with [these men]535-these men ; but [they]535-these men had cast a spell over [her]116-lucy . " Now , did this happen , or did n't it ? Yes or no ? "[535-these men]

[George]118-george replied :

" It happened like this , if it happened at all . " The old trouble ; things wo n't fit . "[570-i]

" ' From far , from eve and morning , And yon twelve - winded sky , The stuff of life to knit [me]570-i Blew hither : here am [I]570-i '[570-i]

[George]118-george and [I]0-i both know this , but why does it distress [him]570-i ? Chapter III : Music , [Violets]151-violets , and the Letter " S "[150-the miss alans]

It so happened that [Lucy]116-lucy , who found daily life rather chaotic , entered [a more solid world]581-a more solid world when [she]116-lucy opened the piano . [She]116-lucy was then no longer either deferential or patronizing ; no longer either [a rebel]582-a rebel or [a slave]583-a slave . [The kingdom of music]584-the kingdom of music is [not [the kingdom]586-the kingdom of [this world]574-this world]585-not the kingdom of this world ; it will accept [those whom breeding and intellect and culture]588-those whom breeding and intellect and culture have alike rejected . [The commonplace person]589-the commonplace person begins to play , and shoots into the empyrean without effort , whilst [we]590-we look up , marvelling how [he]589-the commonplace person has escaped [us]590-we , and thinking how [we]590-we could worship [him]589-the commonplace person and love [him]589-the commonplace person , would [he]589-the commonplace person but translate [his]589-the commonplace person visions into human words , and [his]589-the commonplace person experiences into human actions . Perhaps [he]589-the commonplace person can not ; certainly [he]589-the commonplace person does not , or does so very seldom . [Lucy]116-lucy had done so never .

[She]116-lucy was [no dazzling executante]591-no dazzling executante ; [her]116-lucy runs were not at all like strings of pearls , and [she]116-lucy struck no more right notes than was suitable for one of [her]116-lucy age and situation . Nor was [she]116-lucy [the passionate young lady , who performs so tragically on a summer 's evening with the window open]592-the passionate young lady , who performs so tragically on a summer 's evening with the window open . Passion was there , but it could not be easily labelled ; it slipped between love and hatred and jealousy , and all the furniture of the pictorial style . And [she]116-lucy was tragical only in the sense that [she]116-lucy was great , for [she]116-lucy loved to play on the side of Victory . Victory of what and over what -- that is more than the words of daily life can tell [us]590-we . But that some sonatas of [Beethoven]152-beethoven are written tragic [no one]2143-no one can gainsay ; yet [they]594-they can triumph or despair as [the player]595-the player decides , and [Lucy]116-lucy had decided that [they]594-they should triumph .

A very wet afternoon at [the Bertolini]113-the bertolini permitted [her]116-lucy to do the thing [she]116-lucy really liked , and after lunch [she]116-lucy opened the little draped piano . [A few people]596-a few people lingered round and praised [her]116-lucy playing , but finding that [she]116-lucy made no reply , dispersed to [[their]596-a few people rooms]2168-their rooms to write up [their]596-a few people diaries or to sleep . [She]116-lucy took no notice of [Mr. Emerson]150-the miss alans looking for [[his]150-the miss alans son]319-his son , nor of [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett looking for [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish , nor of [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish looking for [her]131-miss lavish cigarette - case . Like [every true performer]599-every true performer , [she]116-lucy was intoxicated by the mere feel of the notes : they were fingers caressing [her]116-lucy own ; and by touch , not by sound alone , did [she]116-lucy come to [her]116-lucy desire .

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , sitting unnoticed in the window , pondered this illogical element in [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy , and recalled the occasion at [Tunbridge Wells]3-tunbridge wells when [he]119-mr. beebe had discovered it . It was at one of those entertainments where [the upper classes]600-the upper classes entertain [the lower]601-the lower . The seats were filled with [a respectful audience]602-a respectful audience , and [the ladies and gentlemen of [the parish]604-the parish]603-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish , under the auspices of [[their]603-the ladies and gentlemen of the parish vicar]605-their vicar , sang , or recited , or imitated the drawing of a champagne cork . Among the promised items was " [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy . Piano . Beethoven , "[119-mr. beebe] and [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe was wondering whether it would be [Adelaida]153-adelaida , or the march of [The Ruins of [Athens]38-athens]37-the ruins of athens , when [his]119-mr. beebe composure was disturbed by the opening bars of Opus III . [He]119-mr. beebe was in suspense all through the introduction , for not until the pace quickens does [one]2092-one know what [the performer]607-the performer intends . With the roar of the opening theme [he]119-mr. beebe knew that things were going extraordinarily ; in the chords that herald the conclusion [he]119-mr. beebe heard the hammer strokes of victory . [He]119-mr. beebe was glad that [she]607-the performer only played the first movement , for [he]119-mr. beebe could have paid no attention to the winding intricacies of the measures of nine - sixteen . [The audience]534-the audience clapped , no less respectful . It was [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe who started the stamping ; it was all that [one]2092-one could do .

" Who is [she]607-the performer ? "[119-mr. beebe] [he]119-mr. beebe asked [the vicar]610-the vicar afterwards .

" [Cousin of one of [[my]119-mr. beebe parishioners]2311-my parishioners]2310-cousin of one of my parishioners . [I]119-mr. beebe do not consider [her]607-the performer choice of a piece happy . [Beethoven]152-beethoven is so usually simple and direct in [his]152-beethoven appeal that it is sheer perversity to choose a thing like that , which , if anything , disturbs . "[119-mr. beebe]

" Introduce [me]611-a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face . "[611-a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face]

" [She]607-the performer will be delighted . [She]607-the performer and [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett are full of the praises of [your]119-mr. beebe sermon . "[119-mr. beebe]

" [My]119-mr. beebe sermon ? "[119-mr. beebe] cried [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe . " Why ever did [she]607-the performer listen to it ? "[119-mr. beebe]

When [he]119-mr. beebe was introduced [he]119-mr. beebe understood why , for [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy , disjoined from [her]116-lucy music stool , was only [a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face]611-a young lady with a quantity of dark hair and a very pretty , pale , undeveloped face . [She]116-lucy loved going to concerts , [she]116-lucy loved stopping with [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin , [she]116-lucy loved iced coffee and meringues . [He]119-mr. beebe did not doubt that [she]116-lucy loved [his]119-mr. beebe sermon also . But before [he]119-mr. beebe left [Tunbridge Wells]3-tunbridge wells [he]119-mr. beebe made a remark to [the vicar]610-the vicar , which [he]119-mr. beebe now made to [Lucy]116-lucy [herself]116-lucy when [she]116-lucy closed the little piano and moved dreamily towards [him]119-mr. beebe :

" If [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy ever takes to live as [she]116-lucy plays , it will be very exciting both for [us]2312-us and for [her]116-lucy . "[116-lucy]

[Lucy]116-lucy at once re - entered daily life .

" Oh , what a funny thing ! [Some one]2313-some one said just the same to [mother]2108-mother , and [she]116-lucy said [she]116-lucy trusted [I]116-lucy should never live a duet . "[116-lucy]

" Does n't [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch like music ? "[116-lucy]

" [She]116-lucy does n't mind it . But [she]116-lucy does n't like one to get excited over anything ; [she]116-lucy thinks [I]116-lucy am silly about it . [She]116-lucy thinks -- [I]116-lucy ca n't make out . Once , [you]2315-you know , [I]116-lucy said that [I]116-lucy liked [my]116-lucy own playing better than [any one]352-any one 's . [She]116-lucy has never got over it . Of course , [I]116-lucy did n't mean that [I]116-lucy played well ; [I]116-lucy only meant-- "[116-lucy]

" Of course , "[614-he] said [he]614-he , wondering why [she]615-she bothered to explain .

" Music-- "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , as if attempting some generality . [She]116-lucy could not complete it , and looked out absently upon [Italy]11-italy in the wet . The whole life of [the South]10-the south was disorganized , and [the most graceful nation in [Europe]39-europe]616-the most graceful nation in europe had turned into formless lumps of clothes .

[The street]617-the street and [the river]410-the river were dirty yellow , [the bridge]619-the bridge was dirty grey , and [the hills]620-the hills were dirty purple . Somewhere in [their]621-their folds were concealed [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish and [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , who had chosen this afternoon to visit [the Torre del Gallo]40-the torre del gallo .

" What about music ? "[119-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe .

" [Poor Charlotte]155-poor charlotte will be sopped , "[116-lucy] was [Lucy]116-lucy 's reply .

The expedition was typical of [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , who would return cold , tired , hungry , and angelic , with a ruined skirt , [a pulpy Baedeker]622-a pulpy baedeker , and a tickling cough in [her]115-miss bartlett throat . On another day , when [the whole world]623-the whole world was singing and the air ran into the mouth , like wine , [she]115-miss bartlett would refuse to stir from [the drawing - room]385-the drawing - room , saying that [she]115-miss bartlett was an old thing , and no fit companion for [a hearty girl]625-a hearty girl .

" [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish has led [[your]116-lucy cousin]2317-your cousin astray . [She]131-miss lavish hopes to find the true [Italy]11-italy in the wet [I]115-miss bartlett believe . "[115-miss bartlett]

" [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish is so original , "[116-lucy] murmured [Lucy]116-lucy . This was a stock remark , the supreme achievement of [the Pension Bertolini]113-the bertolini in the way of definition . [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish was so original . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe had [his]119-mr. beebe doubts , but they would have been put down to clerical narrowness . " Is it true , "[116-lucy] continued [Lucy]116-lucy in awe - struck tone , " that [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish is writing a book ? "[116-lucy]

" [They]2318-they do say so . "[116-lucy]

"[119-mr. beebe]

" [I]116-lucy wish [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish would tell [me]116-lucy [herself]131-miss lavish . [We]2319-we started [such friends]2320-such friends . " [The two ladies]2321-the two ladies , at all events , have made it up . "[2099-women]

[He]626-he was interested in the sudden friendship between [women]2099-women so apparently dissimilar as [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett and [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish . [They]2099-women were always in [each other]628-each other 's company , with [Lucy]116-lucy a slighted third . [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish [he]626-he believed [he]626-he understood , but [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett might reveal unknown depths of strangeness , though not perhaps , of meaning . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe smiled nonchalantly . [He]119-mr. beebe had made a gentle effort to introduce [the Emersons]648-the emersons into [Bertolini society]649-bertolini society , and the effort had failed . [He]119-mr. beebe was almost [the only person who remained friendly to [them]648-the emersons]650-the only person who remained friendly to them . [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish , who represented intellect , was avowedly hostile , and now [the Miss Alans , who stood for good breeding]651-the miss alans , who stood for good breeding , were following [her]131-miss lavish . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , smarting under an obligation , would scarcely be civil . The case of [Lucy]116-lucy was different . [Lucy]116-lucy , with one eye upon the weather , finally said that [she]116-lucy thought [the Emersons]143-the emersons were nice ; not that [she]116-lucy saw anything of [them]143-the emersons now . Even [their]143-the emersons seats at dinner had been moved .

" Only once . [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett did n't like it , and said something -- quite politely , of course . "[143-the emersons]

" Most right of [her]115-miss bartlett . [They]143-the emersons do n't understand [our]143-the emersons ways . [They]143-the emersons must find [their]143-the emersons level . "[656-the little lady]

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe rather felt that [they]143-the emersons had gone under . [They]143-the emersons had given up [their]143-the emersons attempt -- if it was one -- to conquer society , and now [the father]354-the father was almost as silent as [the son]320-the son . [He]119-mr. beebe wondered whether [he]119-mr. beebe would not plan a pleasant day for [these folk]659-these folk before [they]143-the emersons left -- some expedition , perhaps , with [Lucy]116-lucy well chaperoned to be nice to [them]143-the emersons . It was one of [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe 's chief pleasures to provide [people]308-people with happy memories .

Evening approached while [they]143-the emersons chatted ; the air became brighter ; the colours on the trees and [hills]661-hills were purified , and [the Arno]2-the arno lost its muddy solidity and began to twinkle . There were a few streaks of bluish - green among the clouds , a few patches of watery light upon the earth , and then the dripping facade of [San Miniato]24-san miniato shone brilliantly in the declining sun .

" Too late to go out , "[146-miss alan] said [Miss Alan]146-miss alan in a voice of relief . " [All the galleries]2374-all the galleries are shut . "[146-miss alan]

[[Her]116-lucy two companions]662-her two companions looked grave . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , who felt responsible for [her]116-lucy in the absence of [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , ventured to say :

" [She]116-lucy ought n't really to go at all , "[119-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , as [they]662-her two companions watched [her]116-lucy from the window , " and [she]116-lucy knows it . [I]119-mr. beebe put it down to too much [Beethoven]152-beethoven . "[119-mr. beebe]

Chapter IV : Fourth Chapter

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe was right . [Lucy]116-lucy never knew [her]116-lucy desires so clearly as after music . [She]116-lucy had not really appreciated [the clergyman]335-the clergyman 's wit , nor the suggestive twitterings of [Miss Alan]146-miss alan . Conversation was tedious ; [she]116-lucy wanted something big , and [she]116-lucy believed that it would have come to [her]116-lucy on [the wind - swept platform of [an electric tram]415-an electric tram]666-the wind - swept platform of an electric tram . This [she]116-lucy might not attempt . It was unladylike . Why ? Why were most big things unladylike ? [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett had once explained to [her]116-lucy why . It was not that [ladies]668-ladies were inferior to [men]2100-men ; it was that [they]668-ladies were different . [Their]668-ladies mission was to inspire [others]2278-others to achievement rather than to achieve [themselves]668-ladies . [Indirectly]671-indirectly , by means of tact and a spotless name , [a lady]672-a lady could accomplish much . But if [she]116-lucy rushed into the fray [herself]116-lucy [she]116-lucy would be first censured , then despised , and finally ignored . Poems had been written to illustrate this point .

There is much that is immortal in [this medieval lady]673-this medieval lady . The dragons have gone , and so have [the knights]674-the knights , but still [she]116-lucy lingers in [our]675-our midst . [She]116-lucy reigned in many [an early Victorian castle]676-an early victorian castle , and was [Queen of much early Victorian song]677-queen of much early victorian song . It is sweet to protect [her]116-lucy in the intervals of business , sweet to pay [her]116-lucy honour when [she]116-lucy has cooked [our]675-our dinner well . But alas ! the creature grows degenerate . In [her]116-lucy heart also there are springing up strange desires . [She]116-lucy too is enamoured of heavy winds , and vast panoramas , and green expanses of [the sea]678-the sea . [She]116-lucy has marked [the kingdom of [this world]574-this world]679-the kingdom of this world , how full [it]679-the kingdom of this world is of wealth , and beauty , and war -- a radiant crust , built around the central fires , spinning towards the receding heavens . [Men]2100-men , declaring that [she]116-lucy inspires [them]2100-men to it , move joyfully over the surface , having the most delightful meetings with [other men]682-other men , happy , not because [they]682-other men are masculine , but because [they]682-other men are alive . Before the show breaks up [she]116-lucy would like to drop the august title of [the Eternal Woman]683-the eternal woman , and go [there]337-there as [her]116-lucy transitory self .

[Lucy]116-lucy does not stand for [the medieval lady]685-the medieval lady , who was rather an ideal to which [she]116-lucy was bidden to lift [her]116-lucy eyes when feeling serious . Nor has [she]116-lucy any system of revolt . Here and there a restriction annoyed [her]116-lucy particularly , and [she]116-lucy would transgress it , and perhaps be sorry that [she]116-lucy had done so . This afternoon [she]116-lucy was peculiarly restive . [She]116-lucy would really like to do something of which [[her]116-lucy well - wishers]686-her well - wishers disapproved . Chapter V : Possibilities of a Pleasant Outing

It was [a family]747-a family saying that " [you]2399-you never knew which way [Charlotte Bartlett]115-miss bartlett would turn . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy was perfectly pleasant and sensible over [Lucy]116-lucy 's adventure , found the abridged account of it quite adequate , and paid suitable tribute to the courtesy of [Mr. George Emerson]118-george . [None of [[her]116-lucy friends]751-her friends]750-none of her friends had seen [her]116-lucy , either in [the Piazza]477-the piazza or , later on , by [the embankment]736-the embankment . " And what is the plot ? "[115-miss bartlett]

" [I]131-miss lavish hope [you]2404-you will excuse [me]131-miss lavish for boring on like this , "[131-miss lavish] [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish concluded . " Oh , [you wicked woman]2409-you wicked woman , "[115-miss bartlett] cried [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett . " [I]115-miss bartlett am sure [you]2409-you wicked woman are thinking of [the Emersons]143-the emersons . "[115-miss bartlett]

[Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish gave a Machiavellian smile .

" [I]131-miss lavish confess that in [Italy]11-italy [my]131-miss lavish sympathies are not with [[my]131-miss lavish own countrymen]2410-my own countrymen . [She]116-lucy had read in it of the crocuses which had been bought for yellow and were coming up puce , of [the new parlour - maid , who had watered the ferns with essence of lemonade , of [the semi - detached cottages which were ruining [Summer Street]5-summer street , and breaking the heart of [Sir Harry Otway]135-sir harry]838-the semi - detached cottages which were ruining summer street , and breaking the heart of sir harry otway]837-the new parlour - maid , who had watered the ferns with essence of lemonade , of the semi - detached cottages which were ruining summer street , and breaking the heart of sir harry otway . [She]116-lucy recalled the free , pleasant life of [[her]116-lucy home]839-her home , where [she]116-lucy was allowed to do everything , and where nothing ever happened to [her]116-lucy . [The road up through [the pine - woods]841-the pine - woods]840-the road up through the pine - woods , [the clean drawing - room]842-the clean drawing - room , the view over [the Sussex Weald]55-the sussex weald -- all hung before [her]116-lucy bright and distinct , but pathetic as the pictures in [a gallery to which , after much experience , [a traveller]844-a traveller returns]843-a gallery to which , after much experience , a traveller returns .

" And the news ? "[115-miss bartlett] asked [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett .

" [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse and [[her]172-mrs. vyse son]2466-her son have gone to [Rome]32-rome , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , giving the news that interested [her]116-lucy least . " Do [you]115-miss bartlett know [the Vyses]173-the vyses ? "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy die for it ! "[116-lucy]

[The Piazza Signoria]693-the piazza signoria is too stony to be brilliant . [It]693-the piazza signoria has no grass , no flowers , [no frescoes]846-no frescoes , no glittering walls of marble or comforting patches of ruddy brick . By an odd chance -- unless [we]847-we believe in a presiding genius of places -- the statues that relieve its severity suggest , not the innocence of childhood , nor the glorious bewilderment of youth , but the conscious achievements of maturity . [Perseus]174-perseus and [Judith]175-judith , [Hercules]176-hercules and [Thusnelda]177-thusnelda , [they]848-they have done or suffered something , and though [they]848-they are immortal , immortality has come to [them]848-they after experience , not before . Here , not only in the solitude of Nature , might [a hero]849-a hero meet [a goddess]850-a goddess , or [a heroine]851-a heroine [a god]852-a god .

" [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett ! "[332-the girl] cried [the girl]332-the girl suddenly . " Here 's an idea . "[332-the girl]

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , with equal vivacity , replied :

" Oh , [[you]115-miss bartlett droll person]2473-you droll person ! Pray , what would become of [your]115-miss bartlett drive in [the hills]620-the hills ? "[115-miss bartlett]

[They]854-they passed together through the gaunt beauty of [the square]2381-the square , laughing over the unpractical suggestion .

Chapter VI : [The Reverend Arthur Beebe]178-the reverend arthur beebe , [the Reverend Cuthbert Eager]179-the reverend cuthbert eager , [Mr. Emerson]118-george , [Mr. George Emerson]118-george , [Miss Eleanor Lavish]131-miss lavish , [Miss Charlotte Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , and [Miss Lucy Honeychurch]116-lucy Drive Out in Carriages to See a View ; [Italians Drive]129-italians [Them]856-them .

It was [Phaethon]180-phaethon who drove [them]856-them to [Fiesole]7-fiesole that memorable day , [a youth all irresponsibility and fire]857-a youth all irresponsibility and fire , recklessly urging [[his]180-phaethon master]858-his master 's horses up [the stony hill]859-the stony hill . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe recognized [him]180-phaethon at once . [Neither the Ages of Faith nor the Age of Doubt]860-neither the ages of faith nor the age of doubt had touched [him]180-phaethon ; [he]180-phaethon was [Phaethon]180-phaethon in [Tuscany]57-tuscany driving [a cab]861-a cab . And it was [Persephone]181-persephone whom [he]119-mr. beebe asked leave to pick up on the way , saying that [she]181-persephone was [[his]119-mr. beebe sister]862-his sister -- [Persephone]181-persephone , tall and slender and pale , returning with the Spring to [[[her]181-persephone mother]450-her mother 's cottage]864-her mother 's cottage , and still shading [her]181-persephone eyes from the unaccustomed light . To [her]181-persephone Mr. [Eager]179-the reverend cuthbert eager objected , saying that here was the thin edge of the wedge , and one must guard against imposition . But [the ladies]302-the ladies interceded , and when it had been made clear that it was a very great favour , [the goddess]866-the goddess was allowed to mount beside [the god]867-the god .

[Phaethon]180-phaethon at once slipped the left rein over [her]181-persephone head , thus enabling [himself]180-phaethon to drive with [his]180-phaethon arm round [her]181-persephone waist . [She]181-persephone did not mind . [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager , who sat with [his]148-mr. eager back to the horses , saw nothing of the indecorous proceeding , and continued [his]148-mr. eager conversation with [Lucy]116-lucy . [The other two occupants of]868-the other two occupants of [the carriage]869-the carriage were [old Mr. Emerson]118-george and [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish . For a dreadful thing had happened : [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , without consulting [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager , had doubled the size of [the party]870-the party . And though [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett and [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish had planned all the morning how [the people]2265-the people were to sit , at the critical moment when [the carriages]872-the carriages came round [they]2265-the people lost [their]2265-the people heads , and [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish got in with [Lucy]116-lucy , while [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , with [George Emerson]118-george and [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , followed on behind .

It was hard on [the poor chaplain]873-the poor chaplain to have [his]873-the poor chaplain partie carree thus transformed . Tea at [a Renaissance villa]794-a renaissance villa , if [he]873-the poor chaplain had ever meditated it , was now impossible . [Lucy]116-lucy and [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett had a certain style about [them]2265-the people , and [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , though unreliable , was [a man of parts]875-a man of parts . But [a shoddy lady writer]876-a shoddy lady writer and [a journalist who had murdered [[his]119-mr. beebe wife]2452-his wife in the sight of [God]149-god]877-a journalist who had murdered his wife in the sight of god -- [they]2265-the people should enter [no villa]879-no villa at [his]119-mr. beebe introduction .

[Lucy]116-lucy , elegantly dressed in white , sat erect and nervous amid these explosive ingredients , attentive to [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager , repressive towards [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish , watchful of [old Mr. Emerson]118-george , hitherto fortunately asleep , thanks to a heavy lunch and the drowsy atmosphere of Spring . [She]116-lucy looked on the expedition as the work of [Fate]182-fate . But for it [she]116-lucy would have avoided [George Emerson]118-george successfully . In an open manner [he]118-george had shown that [he]118-george wished to continue [their]880-their intimacy . [She]116-lucy had refused , not because [she]116-lucy disliked [him]118-george , but because [she]116-lucy did not know what had happened , and suspected that [he]118-george did know . And this frightened [her]116-lucy .

For the real event -- whatever it was -- had taken place , not in [the Loggia]697-the loggia , but by [the river]410-the river . To behave wildly at the sight of death is pardonable . But to discuss it afterwards , to pass from discussion into silence , and through silence into sympathy , that is an error , not of a startled emotion , but of the whole fabric . There was really something blameworthy ( [she]116-lucy thought ) in [their]880-their joint contemplation of [the shadowy stream]883-the shadowy stream , in the common impulse which had turned [them]880-their to [the house]884-the house without the passing of a look or word . This sense of wickedness had been slight at first . [She]116-lucy had nearly joined the party to [the Torre del Gallo]40-the torre del gallo . But each time that [she]116-lucy avoided [George]118-george it became more imperative that [she]116-lucy should avoid [him]118-george again . And now [celestial]885-celestial irony , working through [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin and [two clergymen]887-two clergymen , did not suffer [her]116-lucy to leave [Florence]14-florence till [she]116-lucy had made this expedition with [him]118-george through [the hills]620-the hills .

Meanwhile [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager held [her]116-lucy in civil converse ; [their]889-their little tiff was over .

[A hollow like [a great amphitheatre]934-a great amphitheatre , full of [terraced steps and misty olives]935-terraced steps and misty olives]933-a hollow like a great amphitheatre , full of terraced steps and misty olives , now lay between [them]928-we and [the heights of [Fiesole]7-fiesole]936-the heights of fiesole , and [the road]409-the road , still following [its]409-the road curve , was about to sweep on to [a promontory which stood out in [the plain]939-the plain]938-a promontory which stood out in the plain . [He]166-alessio baldovinetti had ascended [it]940-this promontory , [that diligent and rather obscure master , possibly with an eye to business , possibly for the joy of ascending]941-that diligent and rather obscure master , possibly with an eye to business , possibly for the joy of ascending . Chapter VII : [They]993-them Return

Some complicated game had been playing up and down [the hillside]2418-the hillside all the afternoon . What it was and exactly how [the players]995-the players had sided , [Lucy]116-lucy was slow to discover . [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager had met [them]993-them with a questioning eye . [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett had repulsed [him]148-mr. eager with much small talk . There was an explosion up [the road]409-the road . The storm had struck the overhead wire of the tramline , and one of the great supports had fallen . If [they]1027-they had not stopped perhaps [they]1027-they might have been hurt . [They]1027-they chose to regard it as a miraculous preservation , and the floods of love and sincerity , which fructify every hour of life , burst forth in tumult . [They]1027-they descended from [the carriages]872-the carriages ; [they]1027-they embraced [each other]628-each other . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was silent . Indeed , [she]115-miss bartlett had little more to learn . All the way back [Lucy]116-lucy 's body was shaken by deep sighs , which nothing could repress .

" [I]116-lucy want to be truthful , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy whispered . " It is so hard to be absolutely truthful . "[116-lucy]

" Do n't be troubled , [dearest]2116-dearest . Wait till [you]116-lucy are calmer . [We]1039-we will talk it over before bed - time in [[my]332-the girl room]2323-my room . "[332-the girl]

So [they]1039-we re - entered [the city]466-the city with hands clasped . It was a shock to [the girl]332-the girl to find how far emotion had ebbed in [others]2278-others . The storm had ceased , and [Mr. Emerson]118-george was easier about [[his]118-george son]319-his son . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe had regained good humour , and [Mr. Eager]148-mr. eager was already snubbing [Miss Lavish]131-miss lavish . [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett alone [she]116-lucy was sure of -- [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett , whose exterior concealed so much insight and love .

The luxury of self - exposure kept [her]116-lucy almost happy through the long evening . [She]116-lucy thought not so much of what had happened as of how [she]116-lucy should describe it . All [her]116-lucy sensations , [her]116-lucy spasms of courage , [her]116-lucy moments of unreasonable joy , [her]116-lucy mysterious discontent , should be carefully laid before [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin . And together in divine confidence [they]1045-they would disentangle and interpret [them]1046-them all .

" At last , "[116-lucy] thought [she]116-lucy , " [I]116-lucy shall understand [myself]116-lucy . [I]116-lucy sha n't again be troubled by things that come out of nothing , and mean [I]116-lucy do n't know what . "[116-lucy]

[Miss Alan]146-miss alan asked [her]116-lucy to play . [She]116-lucy refused vehemently . Music seemed to [her]116-lucy the employment of [a child]1047-a child . [She]116-lucy sat close to [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin , who , with commendable patience , was listening to a long story about lost luggage . When it was over [she]116-lucy capped it by a story of [her]116-lucy own . [Lucy]116-lucy became rather hysterical with the delay . In vain [she]116-lucy tried to check , or at all events to accelerate , the tale . It was not till a late hour that [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett had recovered [her]116-lucy luggage and could say in [her]116-lucy usual tone of gentle reproach :

" Well , [dear]2102-dear , [I]115-miss bartlett at all events am ready for [Bedfordshire]197-bedfordshire . Come into [[my]115-miss bartlett room]2323-my room , and [I]115-miss bartlett will give a good brush to [your]2102-dear hair . "[115-miss bartlett]

With some solemnity the door was shut , and a cane chair placed for [the girl]332-the girl . Then [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett said " So what is to be done ? "[115-miss bartlett]

[She]116-lucy was unprepared for the question . It had not occurred to [her]116-lucy that [she]116-lucy would have to do anything . A detailed exhibition of [her]116-lucy emotions was all that [she]116-lucy had counted upon .

" What is to be done ? A point , dearest , which [you]2102-dear alone can settle . "[116-lucy]

The rain was streaming down the black windows , and [the great room]1050-the great room felt damp and chilly , One candle burnt trembling on the chest of drawers close to [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett 's toque , which cast monstrous and fantastic shadows on the bolted door . [A tram]1051-a tram roared by in the dark , and [Lucy]116-lucy felt unaccountably sad , though [she]116-lucy had long since dried [her]116-lucy eyes . [She]116-lucy lifted them to the ceiling , where the griffins and bassoons were colourless and vague , the very ghosts of joy .

" It has been raining for nearly four hours , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said at last .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett ignored the remark .

" How do [you]116-lucy propose to silence [him]2561-him ? "[116-lucy]

" [The driver]2196-the driver ? "[116-lucy]

" [[My]116-lucy dear girl]2563-my dear girl , no ; [Mr. George Emerson]118-george . "[116-lucy]

[Lucy]116-lucy began to pace up and down [the room]328-the room .

" [I]116-lucy do n't understand , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said at last .

[She]116-lucy understood very well , but [she]116-lucy no longer wished to be absolutely truthful .

" How are [you]116-lucy going to stop [him]2561-him talking about it ? "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy have a feeling that talk is a thing [he]2561-him will never do . "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy , too , intend to judge [him]2561-him charitably . But unfortunately [I]116-lucy have met [the type]2564-the type before . [They]2564-the type seldom keep [their]2564-the type exploits to [themselves]2564-the type . "[116-lucy]

" Exploits ? "[116-lucy] cried [Lucy]116-lucy , wincing under the horrible plural .

" [[My]116-lucy poor dear]2565-my poor dear , did [you]116-lucy suppose that this was [his]2561-him first ? Come here and listen to [me]116-lucy . " Yes , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , whom at the time the argument had pleased .

" Well , [I]116-lucy am [no prude]2567-no prude . There is no need to call [him]2561-him [a wicked young man]2568-a wicked young man , but obviously [he]2561-him is thoroughly unrefined . An idea rushed across [Lucy]116-lucy 's brain , which , had [she]116-lucy thought of it sooner and made it part of [her]116-lucy , might have proved victorious .

" [I]116-lucy propose to speak to [him]2561-him , "[116-lucy] said [she]116-lucy .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett uttered a cry of genuine alarm .

" [You]116-lucy see , [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett , [your]116-lucy kindness -- [I]116-lucy shall never forget it . But -- as [you]116-lucy said -- it is [my]116-lucy affair . [Mine]116-lucy and [his]2561-him . "[116-lucy]

" But [we]2570-we fear [him]2561-him for [you]116-lucy , [dear]2102-dear . " [I]116-lucy should have-- "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy checked [herself]116-lucy , and broke the sentence off . [She]116-lucy went up to the dripping window and strained [her]116-lucy eyes into the darkness . [She]116-lucy could not think what [she]116-lucy would have done .

[Lucy]116-lucy obeyed . [She]116-lucy was in [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin 's power . [She]116-lucy could not modulate out the key of self - abasement in which [she]116-lucy had started . [Neither of [them]1055-them]1054-neither of them referred again to [her]116-lucy suggestion that [she]116-lucy should speak to [George]118-george and settle the matter , whatever it was , with [him]118-george .

" [Signora Bertolini]114-the signora would be upset . "[115-miss bartlett]

" Yes , but [they]1057-they pay extra for wine . "[115-miss bartlett] After this remark [she]115-miss bartlett remained motionless and silent . To [her]115-miss bartlett tired eyes [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett throbbed and swelled like a ghostly figure in a dream .

[They]1057-they began to sort [their]1057-they clothes for packing , for there was no time to lose , if [they]1057-they were to catch [the train]2588-the train to [Rome]32-rome . [Lucy]116-lucy , when admonished , began to move to and fro between [the rooms]2101-the rooms , more conscious of the discomforts of packing by candlelight than of a subtler ill . [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett , who was practical without ability , knelt by the side of an empty trunk , vainly endeavouring to pave it with books of varying thickness and size . [She]115-miss bartlett gave two or three sighs , for the stooping posture hurt [her]115-miss bartlett back , and , for all [her]115-miss bartlett diplomacy , [she]115-miss bartlett felt that [she]115-miss bartlett was growing old . [The girl]332-the girl heard [her]115-miss bartlett as [she]115-miss bartlett entered [the room]328-the room , and was seized with one of those emotional impulses to which [she]115-miss bartlett could never attribute a cause . [She]115-miss bartlett only felt that the candle would burn better , the packing go easier , [the world]2106-the world be happier , if [she]115-miss bartlett could give and receive some human love . The impulse had come before to - day , but never so strongly . [She]115-miss bartlett knelt down by [[her]115-miss bartlett cousin]317-her cousin 's side and took [her]317-her cousin in [her]115-miss bartlett arms .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett returned the embrace with tenderness and warmth . But [she]115-miss bartlett was not [a stupid woman]1064-a stupid woman , and [she]115-miss bartlett knew perfectly well that [Lucy]116-lucy did not love [her]115-miss bartlett , but needed [her]115-miss bartlett to love . For it was in ominous tones that [she]115-miss bartlett said , after a long pause :

" Dearest [Lucy]116-lucy , how will [you]116-lucy ever forgive [me]115-miss bartlett ? "[115-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]116-lucy was on [her]116-lucy guard at once , knowing by bitter experience what forgiving [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett meant . [Her]116-lucy emotion relaxed , [she]116-lucy modified [her]116-lucy embrace a little , and [she]116-lucy said :

" [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett dear , what do [you]115-miss bartlett mean ? As if [I]116-lucy have anything to forgive ! "[116-lucy]

" But no-- "[116-lucy]

" [You]115-miss bartlett must n't say these things , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy softly .

[She]116-lucy still clung to the hope that [she]116-lucy and [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett loved [each other]628-each other , heart and soul . [They]1067-they continued to pack in silence .

" [I]115-miss bartlett have been [a failure]2596-a failure , "[115-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , as [she]115-miss bartlett struggled with the straps of [Lucy]116-lucy 's trunk instead of strapping [her]115-miss bartlett own . [Lucy]116-lucy , from a cowardly wish to improve the situation , said :

" Why need [mother]2108-mother hear of it ? "[628-each other]

" But [you]115-miss bartlett tell [her]2095-your mother everything ? "[628-each other]

" Naturally [I]628-each other should have told [her]2095-your mother . [I]628-each other will never speak of it either to [her]2095-your mother or to [any one]352-any one . "[628-each other]

[Her]1069-her promise brought the long - drawn interview to a sudden close . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett pecked [her]332-the girl smartly on both cheeks , wished [her]332-the girl good - night , and sent [her]332-the girl to [[her]332-the girl own room]398-her own room .

For a moment the original trouble was in the background . [George]118-george would seem to have behaved like [a cad throughout]1071-a cad throughout ; perhaps that was the view which [one]2092-one would take eventually . At present [she]115-miss bartlett neither acquitted nor condemned [him]118-george ; [she]115-miss bartlett did not pass judgement . At the moment when [she]115-miss bartlett was about to judge [him]118-george [[her]115-miss bartlett cousin]317-her cousin 's voice had intervened , and , ever since , it was [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett who had dominated ; [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett who , [even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall]1074-even now , could be heard sighing into a crack in the partition wall ; [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , who had really been neither pliable nor humble nor inconsistent . [She]115-miss bartlett had worked like [a great artist]811-a great artist ; for a time -- indeed , for years -- [she]115-miss bartlett had been meaningless , but at the end there was presented to [the girl]332-the girl the complete picture of a cheerless , loveless world in which [the young]1077-the young rush to destruction until [they]1077-the young learn better -- a shamefaced world of precautions and barriers which may avert evil , but which do not seem to bring good , if [we]1078-we may judge from [those who have used them most]1079-those who have used them most .

[Lucy]116-lucy was suffering from the most grievous wrong which [this world]574-this world has yet discovered : diplomatic advantage had been taken of [her]116-lucy sincerity , of [her]116-lucy craving for sympathy and love . Such a wrong is not easily forgotten . Never again did [she]116-lucy expose [herself]116-lucy without due consideration and precaution against rebuff . And such a wrong may react disastrously upon the soul .

The door - bell rang , and [she]116-lucy started to the shutters . Before [she]116-lucy reached them [she]116-lucy hesitated , turned , and blew out the candle . Thus it was that , though [she]116-lucy saw [someone]1081-someone standing in the wet below , [he]1081-someone , though [he]1081-someone looked up , did not see [her]116-lucy .

To reach [[his]1081-someone room]1082-his room [he]1081-someone had to go by [hers]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy was still dressed . It struck [her]116-lucy that [she]116-lucy might slip into [the passage]1083-the passage and just say that [she]116-lucy would be gone before [he]1081-someone was up , and that [their]1084-their extraordinary intercourse was over .

Whether [she]116-lucy would have dared to do this was never proved . At the critical moment [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett opened [her]115-miss bartlett own door , and [her]115-miss bartlett voice said :

" [I]115-miss bartlett wish one word with [you]1081-someone in [the drawing - room]385-the drawing - room , [Mr. Emerson]118-george , please . "[115-miss bartlett]

Soon [their]1084-their footsteps returned , and [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett said : " Good - night , [Mr. Emerson]118-george . "[115-miss bartlett]

[His]1081-someone heavy , tired breathing was the only reply ; [the chaperon]1085-the chaperon had done [her]1085-the chaperon work .

[Lucy]116-lucy cried aloud : " It is n't true . It ca n't all be true . [I]116-lucy want not to be muddled . [I]116-lucy want to grow older quickly . "[116-lucy]

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett tapped on the wall .

" Go to bed at once , [dear]2102-dear . [You]2102-dear need all the rest [you]2102-dear can get . "[116-lucy]

In the morning [they]1084-their left for [Rome]32-rome .

Part Two

Chapter VIII : Medieval

The drawing - room curtains at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner had been pulled to meet , for the carpet was new and deserved protection from the August sun . They were heavy curtains , reaching almost to the ground , and the light that filtered through them was subdued and varied . [A poet]1086-a poet -- [none]1087-none was present -- might have quoted , " Life like a dome of many coloured glass , "[1087-none] or might have compared the curtains to sluice - gates , lowered against the intolerable tides of heaven . Without was poured a sea of radiance ; within , the glory , though visible , was tempered to the capacities of [man]2279-man .

[Two pleasant people]1089-two pleasant people sat in [the room]328-the room . [One]2092-one -- [a boy of nineteen]1092-a boy of nineteen -- was studying a small manual of anatomy , and peering occasionally at a bone which lay upon the piano . From time to time [he]2092-one bounced in [his]2092-one chair and puffed and groaned , for the day was hot and the print small , and the human frame fearfully made ; and [[his]2092-one mother]1093-his mother , who was writing a letter , did continually read out to [him]2092-one what [she]1093-his mother had written . And continually did [she]1093-his mother rise from [her]1093-his mother seat and part the curtains so that a rivulet of light fell across the carpet , and make the remark that they were still there .

" Where are n't [they]1089-two pleasant people ? "[733-the boy] said [the boy]733-the boy , who was [Freddy]124-freddy , [[Lucy]116-lucy 's brother]1095-lucy 's brother . " [I]733-the boy tell [you]154-mrs. honeychurch [I]733-the boy 'm getting fairly sick . "[733-the boy]

" For goodness ' sake go out of [[my]154-mrs. honeychurch drawing - room]2605-my drawing - room , then ? "[154-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , who hoped to cure [[her]154-mrs. honeychurch children]1096-her children of slang by taking it literally .

[Freddy]124-freddy did not move or reply .

" [I]154-mrs. honeychurch think things are coming to a head , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] [she]154-mrs. honeychurch observed , rather wanting [[her]154-mrs. honeychurch son]2466-her son 's opinion on the situation if [she]154-mrs. honeychurch could obtain it without undue supplication .

" Time [they]1089-two pleasant people did . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]154-mrs. honeychurch am glad that [Cecil]198-cecil is asking [her]154-mrs. honeychurch this once more . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" It 's [his]198-cecil third go , is n't it ? "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [Freddy]124-freddy [I]154-mrs. honeychurch do call the way [you]124-freddy talk unkind . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]124-freddy did n't mean to be unkind . "[124-freddy] Then [he]124-freddy added : " But [I]124-freddy do think [Lucy]116-lucy might have got this off [her]116-lucy chest in [Italy]11-italy . [I]124-freddy do n't know how [girls]2606-girls manage things , but [she]116-lucy ca n't have said ' No ' properly before , or [she]116-lucy would n't have to say it again now . Over the whole thing -- [I]124-freddy ca n't explain -- [I]124-freddy do feel so uncomfortable . "[124-freddy]

" Do [you]124-freddy indeed , [dear]2102-dear ? How interesting ! "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]124-freddy feel -- never mind . "[124-freddy]

[He]124-freddy returned to [his]124-freddy work .

" Just listen to what [I]154-mrs. honeychurch have written to [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse . [I]154-mrs. honeychurch said : ' [Dear Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse . ' "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" Yes , [mother]2108-mother , [you]124-freddy told [me]154-mrs. honeychurch . A jolly good letter . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]1098-i said : ' [Dear Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse , [Cecil]198-cecil has just asked [my]1098-i permission about it , and [I]1098-i should be delighted , if [Lucy]116-lucy wishes it . [Cecil]198-cecil entered .

Appearing thus late in the story , [Cecil]198-cecil must be at once described . [He]198-cecil was medieval . Like a Gothic statue . Tall and refined , with shoulders that seemed braced square by an effort of the will , and a head that was tilted a little higher than the usual level of vision , [he]198-cecil resembled [those fastidious saints who guard the portals of [a French cathedral]1119-a french cathedral]1118-those fastidious saints who guard the portals of a french cathedral . A Gothic statue implies celibacy , just as a Greek statue implies fruition , and perhaps this was what [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe meant . And [Freddy]124-freddy , who ignored history and art , perhaps meant the same when [he]124-freddy failed to imagine [Cecil]198-cecil wearing [another fellow]1111-another fellow 's cap .

Smiling indulgently , [he]198-cecil lit a cigarette , and rehearsed the events that had led to such a happy conclusion .

[He]198-cecil had known [Lucy]116-lucy for several years , but only as [a commonplace girl who happened to be musical]1136-a commonplace girl who happened to be musical . [He]198-cecil could still remember [his]198-cecil depression that afternoon at [Rome]32-rome , when [she]116-lucy and [[her]116-lucy terrible cousin]1137-her terrible cousin fell on [him]198-cecil out of the blue , and demanded to be taken to [St. Peter 's]4-st. peter . That day [she]116-lucy had seemed [a typical tourist]1138-a typical tourist -- shrill , crude , and gaunt with travel . But [Italy]11-italy worked some marvel in [her]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy was like [a woman of [Leonardo da Vinci]203-leonardo da vinci 's , whom [we]1140-we love not so much for [herself]116-lucy as for the things that [she]116-lucy will not tell [us]1140-we]1139-a woman of leonardo da vinci 's , whom we love not so much for herself as for the things that she will not tell us . The things are assuredly not of this life ; [no woman of Leonardo]1141-no woman of leonardo 's could have anything so vulgar as a " story . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy did develop most wonderfully day by day .

So it happened that from patronizing civility [he]198-cecil had slowly passed if not to passion , at least to a profound uneasiness . Already at [Rome]32-rome [he]198-cecil had hinted to [her]116-lucy that [they]1142-they might be suitable for [each other]628-each other . It had touched [him]198-cecil greatly that [she]116-lucy had not broken away at the suggestion . [Her]116-lucy refusal had been clear and gentle ; after it -- as the horrid phrase went -- [she]116-lucy had been exactly the same to [him]198-cecil as before . Three months later , on [the margin of [Italy]11-italy]1144-the margin of italy , among [the flower - clad Alps]1145-the flower - clad alps , [he]198-cecil had asked [her]116-lucy again in bald , traditional language . [She]116-lucy reminded [him]198-cecil of [a Leonardo]1146-a leonardo more than ever ; [her]116-lucy sunburnt features were shadowed by fantastic rock ; at [his]198-cecil words [she]116-lucy had turned and stood between [him]198-cecil and the light with immeasurable plains behind [her]116-lucy . [He]198-cecil walked [home]381-home with [her]116-lucy unashamed , feeling not at all like [a rejected suitor]1148-a rejected suitor . The things that really mattered were unshaken .

So now [he]198-cecil had asked [her]116-lucy once more , and , clear and gentle as ever , [she]116-lucy had accepted [him]198-cecil , giving no coy reasons for [her]116-lucy delay , but simply saying that [she]116-lucy loved [him]198-cecil and would do [her]116-lucy best to make [him]198-cecil happy . [[His]198-cecil mother]1093-his mother , too , would be pleased ; [she]1093-his mother had counselled the step ; [he]198-cecil must write [her]1093-his mother a long account .

" [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe ! " [Grazie tante]2667-grazie tante ! "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , who did not like parsons .

[Freddy]1186-freddy , now full of geniality , whistled the wedding march . [Youth]801-youth seldom criticizes the accomplished fact .

" Indeed [I]1186-freddy have ! "[1186-freddy] [he]1186-freddy cried . [He]1186-freddy looked at [Lucy]116-lucy . " [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , [I]1186-freddy 'm going to do what [I]1186-freddy am always supposed to do , but generally [I]1186-freddy 'm too shy . " [You]1188-the parson only asked for it just in time , "[1189-the lady] [the lady]1189-the lady retorted . " How dare [you]1188-the parson be serious at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner ? "[1189-the lady]

[He]1188-the parson took [his]1188-the parson tone from [her]1189-the lady . There was no more heavy beneficence , no more attempts to dignify the situation with poetry or [the Scriptures]216-the scriptures . None of [them]1190-they dared or was able to be serious any more .

An engagement is so potent a thing that sooner or later it reduces [all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe]1191-all who speak of it to this state of cheerful awe . Away from it , in the solitude of [[their]1190-they rooms]2168-their rooms , [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , and even [Freddy]1193-freddy , might again be critical . But in its presence and in the presence of [each other]628-each other [they]1190-they were sincerely hilarious . It has a strange power , for it compels not only the lips , but the very heart . The chief parallel to compare one great thing with another -- is the power over [us]1195-we of [a temple of some alien creed]1196-a temple of some alien creed . Standing outside , [we]1195-we deride or oppose it , or at the most feel sentimental . Inside , though [the saints and gods]1197-the saints and gods are not [ours]1195-we , [we]1195-we become [true believers]1198-true believers , in case [any true believer]1199-any true believer should be present .

So it was that after the gropings and the misgivings of the afternoon [they]1190-they pulled [themselves]1190-they together and settled down to a very pleasant tea - party . If [they]1190-they were [hypocrites]1200-hypocrites [they]1190-they did not know it , and [their]1190-they hypocrisy had every chance of setting and of becoming true . [Anne]212-anne , putting down each plate as if it were a wedding present , stimulated [them]1190-they greatly . [They]1190-they could not lag behind that smile of [hers]212-anne which [she]212-anne gave [them]1190-they ere [she]212-anne kicked the drawing - room door . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe chirruped . [Freddy]124-freddy was at [his]124-freddy wittiest , referring to [Cecil]198-cecil as the " Fiasco"--family[124-freddy] honoured pun on [fiance]1201-fiance . [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , amusing and portly , promised well as [a mother - in - law]1202-a mother - in - law . As for [Lucy]116-lucy and [Cecil]198-cecil , for whom [the temple]1203-the temple had been built , [they]1190-they also joined in the merry ritual , but waited , as [earnest worshippers]1204-earnest worshippers should , for the disclosure of some holier shrine of joy .

Chapter IX : [Lucy]116-lucy As a Work of Art

A few days after the engagement was announced [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch made [Lucy]116-lucy and [[her]116-lucy Fiasco]1205-her fiasco come to a little garden - party in [the neighbourhood]2406-the neighbourhood , for naturally [she]154-mrs. honeychurch wanted to show [people]308-people that [[her]154-mrs. honeychurch daughter]360-her daughter was marrying [a presentable man]1209-a presentable man .

[Cecil]198-cecil was more than presentable ; [he]198-cecil looked distinguished , and it was very pleasant to see [his]198-cecil slim figure keeping step with [Lucy]116-lucy , and [his]198-cecil long , fair face responding when [Lucy]116-lucy spoke to [him]198-cecil . [People]308-people congratulated [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , which is , [I]0-i believe , a social blunder , but it pleased [her]154-mrs. honeychurch , and [she]154-mrs. honeychurch introduced [Cecil]198-cecil rather indiscriminately to [some stuffy dowagers]1211-some stuffy dowagers .

At tea a misfortune took place : a cup of coffee was upset over [Lucy]116-lucy 's figured silk , and though [Lucy]116-lucy feigned indifference , [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother feigned nothing of the sort but dragged [her]116-lucy indoors to have the frock treated by [a sympathetic maid]1213-a sympathetic maid . [They]1214-they were gone some time , and [Cecil]198-cecil was left with [the dowagers]1215-the dowagers . When [they]1214-they returned [he]198-cecil was not as pleasant as [he]198-cecil had been .

" Do [you]116-lucy go to much of this sort of thing ? "[198-cecil] [he]198-cecil asked when [they]1214-they were driving [home]381-home .

" Oh , now and then , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , who had rather enjoyed [herself]116-lucy .

" Is it typical of country society ? "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy suppose so . [Mother]2108-mother , would it be ? "[116-lucy]

" Plenty of society , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , who was trying to remember the hang of one of the dresses .

Seeing that [her]154-mrs. honeychurch thoughts were elsewhere , [Cecil]198-cecil bent towards [Lucy]116-lucy and said :

" To [me]198-cecil it seemed perfectly appalling , disastrous , portentous . "[198-cecil]

" [I]154-mrs. honeychurch am so sorry that [you]198-cecil were stranded . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" Not that , but the congratulations . It is so disgusting , the way an engagement is regarded as public property -- a kind of waste place where [every outsider]2674-every outsider may shoot [his]2674-every outsider vulgar sentiment . [All those old women]2675-all those old women smirking ! "[198-cecil]

" [One]2092-one has to go through it , [I]154-mrs. honeychurch suppose . [They]2675-all those old women wo n't notice [us]2677-us so much next time . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" But [my]198-cecil point is that [their]2675-all those old women whole attitude is wrong . An engagement -- horrid word in the first place -- is a private matter , and should be treated as such . "[198-cecil]

Yet [the smirking old women]1217-the smirking old women , however wrong individually , were racially correct . The spirit of [the generations]1218-the generations had smiled through [them]1217-the smirking old women , rejoicing in the engagement of [Cecil]198-cecil and [Lucy]116-lucy because it promised the continuance of life on [earth]1219-earth . To [Cecil]198-cecil and [Lucy]116-lucy it promised something quite different -- personal love . Hence [Cecil]198-cecil 's irritation and [Lucy]116-lucy 's belief that [his]198-cecil irritation was just .

" How tiresome ! "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said . " Could n't [you]198-cecil have escaped to tennis ? "[116-lucy]

" [I]1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother do n't play tennis -- at least , not in public . [The neighbourhood]2406-the neighbourhood is deprived of the romance of [me]1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother being athletic .
