"[1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother]

" Inglese Italianato ? "[116-lucy]

" E un diavolo incarnato ! [You]198-cecil know the proverb ? "[1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother]

[She]116-lucy did not . Nor did it seem applicable to [a young man who had spent a quiet winter in [Rome]32-rome with [[his]1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother mother]1093-his mother]1220-a young man who had spent a quiet winter in rome with his mother . But [Cecil]198-cecil , since [his]198-cecil engagement , had taken to affect a cosmopolitan naughtiness which [he]198-cecil was far from possessing .

" Well , "[198-cecil] said [he]198-cecil , " [I]198-cecil can not help it if [they]2679-they do disapprove of [me]198-cecil . There are certain irremovable barriers between [myself]198-cecil and [them]2679-they , and [I]198-cecil must accept them . "[198-cecil]

" [We]2680-we all have [our]2680-we limitations , [I]116-lucy suppose , "[116-lucy] said [wise Lucy]116-lucy .

" Sometimes [they]2679-they are forced on [us]2680-we , though , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , who saw from [her]116-lucy remark that [she]116-lucy did not quite understand [his]198-cecil position .

" How ? "[198-cecil]

" It makes a difference does n't it , whether [we]2680-we fully fence [ourselves]2680-we in , or whether [we]2680-we are fenced out by the barriers of [others]2278-others ? "[198-cecil]

[She]116-lucy thought a moment , and agreed that it did make a difference .

" Difference ? "[154-mrs. honeychurch] cried [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , suddenly alert . " [I]154-mrs. honeychurch do n't see any difference . Fences are fences , especially when they are in the same place . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [We]2680-we were speaking of motives , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , on whom the interruption jarred .

" [[My]116-lucy dear]2145-my dear [Cecil]198-cecil , look here . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy spread out [her]116-lucy knees and perched [her]116-lucy card - case on [her]116-lucy lap . " This is [me]116-lucy . That 's [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . The rest of the pattern is [the other people]2683-the other people . Motives are all very well , but the fence comes here . "[116-lucy]

" [We]2680-we were n't talking of real fences , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , laughing .

" Oh , [I]116-lucy see , [dear]2102-dear -- poetry . "[116-lucy]

[She]116-lucy leant placidly back . [Cecil]198-cecil wondered why [Lucy]116-lucy had been amused .

" [I]116-lucy tell [you]198-cecil who has no ' fences , ' as [you]198-cecil call [them]2685-them , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said , " and that 's [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe . "[116-lucy]

" [A parson fenceless]2686-a parson fenceless would mean [a parson defenceless]2687-a parson defenceless . "[308-people]

[Lucy]116-lucy was slow to follow what [people]308-people said , but quick enough to detect what [they]308-people meant . [She]116-lucy missed [Cecil]198-cecil 's epigram , but grasped the feeling that prompted it .

" Do n't [you]198-cecil like [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe ? "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy asked thoughtfully .

If [Cecil]198-cecil disliked [Sir Harry Otway]135-sir harry and [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , what guarantee was there that [the people who really mattered to [her]116-lucy]1284-the people who really mattered to her would escape ? For instance , [Freddy]124-freddy . [Freddy]124-freddy was neither clever , nor subtle , nor beautiful , and what prevented [Cecil]198-cecil from saying , any minute , " It would be wrong not to loathe [Freddy]124-freddy "[198-cecil] ? And what would [she]116-lucy reply ? Further than [Freddy]124-freddy [she]116-lucy did not go , but [he]124-freddy gave [her]116-lucy anxiety enough . [She]116-lucy could only assure [herself]116-lucy that [Cecil]198-cecil had known [Freddy]124-freddy some time , and that [they]1285-we had always got on pleasantly , except , perhaps , during the last few days , which was an accident , perhaps .

" Which way shall [we]1285-we go ? "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy asked [him]124-freddy .

Nature -- simplest of topics , [she]116-lucy thought -- was around [them]1285-we . [Summer Street]5-summer street lay deep in [the woods]1234-the woods , and [she]116-lucy had stopped where [a footpath]1287-a footpath diverged from [the highroad]1288-the highroad .

" Are there two ways ? "[116-lucy]

" Perhaps [the road]409-the road is more sensible , as [we]1285-we 're got up smart . "[116-lucy]

" [I]198-cecil 'd rather go through [the wood]2789-the wood , "[198-cecil] said [Cecil]198-cecil , With that subdued irritation that [she]116-lucy had noticed in [him]198-cecil all the afternoon . " Have n't [I]116-lucy ? [The wood]2789-the wood , then , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy , startled at [his]198-cecil queerness , but pretty sure that [he]198-cecil would explain later ; it was not [his]198-cecil habit to leave [her]116-lucy in doubt as to [his]198-cecil meaning .

[She]116-lucy led the way into the whispering pines , and sure enough [he]198-cecil did explain before [they]1289-they had gone a dozen yards .

" [I]198-cecil had got an idea -- [I]198-cecil dare say wrongly -- that [you]198-cecil feel more at [home]381-home with [me]198-cecil in [a room]2796-a room . "[198-cecil]

As no explanation was forthcoming , [she]116-lucy shook off the subject as too difficult for [a girl]521-a girl , and led [him]1290-you further into [the wood]2789-the wood , pausing every now and then at some particularly beautiful or familiar combination of the trees . [She]116-lucy had known [the wood between [Summer Street]5-summer street and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner]1293-the wood between summer street and windy corner ever since [she]116-lucy could walk alone ; [she]116-lucy had played at losing [Freddy]124-freddy in [it]2789-the wood , when [Freddy]124-freddy was [a purple - faced baby]1294-a purple - faced baby ; and though [she]116-lucy had been to [Italy]11-italy , it had lost none of its charm .

Presently [they]1295-they came to [a little clearing among the pines]1296-a little clearing among the pines -- another tiny green alp , solitary this time , and holding in its bosom a shallow pool .

[She]116-lucy exclaimed , " [The Sacred Lake]70-the sacred lake ! "[116-lucy]

" Why do [you]124-freddy call it that ? "[124-freddy]

" [I]116-lucy ca n't remember why . [I]116-lucy suppose it comes out of some book . It 's only a puddle now , but [you]124-freddy see that stream going through it ? Well , a good deal of water comes down after heavy rains , and ca n't get away at once , and [the pool]2806-the pool becomes quite large and beautiful . Then [Freddy]124-freddy used to bathe [there]337-there . [He]124-freddy is very fond of it . "[116-lucy]

" And [you]116-lucy ? "[124-freddy]

[He]124-freddy meant , " Are [you]116-lucy fond of it ? "[116-lucy] But [she]116-lucy answered dreamily , " [I]116-lucy bathed [here]2087-here , too , till [I]116-lucy was found out . Then there was a row . "[116-lucy]

At another time [he]124-freddy might have been shocked , for [he]124-freddy had depths of prudishness within [him]124-freddy . [She]116-lucy was got up smart , as [she]116-lucy phrased it , and [she]116-lucy reminded [him]124-freddy of some brilliant flower that has no leaves of its own , but blooms abruptly out of a world of green .

" Who found [you]116-lucy out ? "[116-lucy]

" [Lucy]116-lucy ! "[124-freddy]

At that supreme moment [he]124-freddy was conscious of nothing but absurdities . [Her]116-lucy reply was inadequate . [She]116-lucy gave such a business - like lift to [her]116-lucy veil . Such was the embrace . [He]124-freddy considered , with truth , that it had been a failure . Passion should believe itself irresistible . [It]1299-it should forget civility and consideration and all the other curses of a refined nature . Above all , it should never ask for leave where there is a right of way . Why could [he]124-freddy not do as [any labourer]1300-any labourer or navvy -- nay , as [any young man behind the counter]1301-any young man behind the counter would have done ? [He]124-freddy recast the scene . [Lucy]116-lucy was standing flowerlike by [the water]1302-the water , [he]124-freddy rushed up and took [her]116-lucy in [his]124-freddy arms ; [she]116-lucy rebuked [him]124-freddy , permitted [him]124-freddy and revered [him]124-freddy ever after for [his]124-freddy manliness . For [he]124-freddy believed that [women]2099-women revere [men]2100-men for [their]2099-women manliness .

[They]1305-they left the pool in silence , after this one salutation . [He]124-freddy waited for [her]116-lucy to make some remark which should show [him]124-freddy [her]116-lucy inmost thoughts . At last [she]116-lucy spoke , and with fitting gravity .

" [Emerson]118-george was the name , not [Harris]135-sir harry . "[116-lucy]

[He]124-freddy could not know that this was the most intimate conversation [they]1305-they had ever had .

Chapter X : [Cecil]198-cecil as [a Humourist

The society out of which [Cecil]198-cecil proposed to rescue [Lucy]116-lucy]1306-a humourist the society out of which cecil proposed to rescue lucy was perhaps no very splendid affair , yet it was more splendid than [her]116-lucy antecedents entitled [her]116-lucy to . [[Her]116-lucy father]1307-her father , [a prosperous local solicitor]1308-a prosperous local solicitor , had built [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , as a speculation at the time [the district]1309-the district was opening up , and , falling in love with [his]1307-her father own creation , had ended by living [there]337-there [himself]1307-her father . Soon after [his]1307-her father marriage the social atmosphere began to alter . [Other houses]1311-other houses were built on the brow of [that steep southern slope]1312-that steep southern slope and others , again , among the pine - trees behind , and northward on [the chalk barrier of [the downs]1314-the downs]1313-the chalk barrier of the downs . [Most of [these houses]1316-these houses]1315-most of these houses were larger than [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , and were filled by [people who came , not from [the district]1309-the district , but from [London]1-london , and who mistook [the Honeychurches]207-the honeychurches for the remnants of [an indigenous aristocracy]1319-an indigenous aristocracy]1317-people who came , not from the district , but from london , and who mistook the honeychurches for the remnants of an indigenous aristocracy . [He]1307-her father was inclined to be frightened , but [[his]1307-her father wife]2452-his wife accepted the situation without either pride or humility . " [I]2452-his wife can not think what [people]308-people are doing , "[2452-his wife] [she]2452-his wife would say , " but it is extremely fortunate for [the children]2333-the children . "[2452-his wife] [She]2452-his wife called everywhere ; [her]2452-his wife calls were returned with enthusiasm , and by the time [people]308-people found out that [she]2452-his wife was not exactly of [their]308-people milieu , [they]308-people liked [her]2452-his wife , and it did not seem to matter . When [Mr. Honeychurch]224-mr. honeychurch died , [he]1307-her father had the satisfaction -- which [few honest solicitors]1322-few honest solicitors despise -- of leaving [[his]1307-her father family]1323-his family rooted in the best society obtainable .

The best obtainable . Certainly [many of [the immigrants]1325-the immigrants]1324-many of the immigrants were rather dull , and [Lucy]116-lucy realized this more vividly since [her]116-lucy return from [Italy]11-italy . Hitherto [she]116-lucy had accepted [their]308-people ideals without questioning -- [their]308-people kindly affluence , [their]308-people inexplosive religion , [their]308-people dislike of paper - bags , orange - peel , and broken bottles . [A Radical]2214-a radical out and out , [she]116-lucy learnt to speak with horror of [Suburbia]1327-suburbia . Life , so far as [she]116-lucy troubled to conceive it , was a circle of [rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes]1328-rich , pleasant people , with identical interests and identical foes . In this circle , [one]2092-one thought , married , and died . [Outside]1330-outside [it]1331-it were poverty and vulgarity for ever trying to enter , just as the [London]1-london fog tries to enter [the pine - woods]841-the pine - woods pouring through the gaps in [the northern hills]1333-the northern hills . But , in [Italy]11-italy , where any one who chooses may warm [himself]1334-himself in equality , as in the sun , this conception of life vanished . [Her]116-lucy senses expanded ; [she]116-lucy felt that there was [no one whom [she]116-lucy might not get to like]1335-no one whom she might not get to like , that social barriers were irremovable , doubtless , but not particularly high . [You]1336-you jump over them just as [you]1336-you jump into [[a peasant]1337-a peasant 's olive - yard in [the Apennines]17-the apennines]1338-a peasant 's olive - yard in the apennines , and [he]1337-a peasant is glad to see [you]1336-you . [She]116-lucy returned with new eyes .

So did [Cecil]198-cecil ; but [Italy]11-italy had quickened [Cecil]198-cecil , not to tolerance , but to irritation . [He]198-cecil saw that [the local society]1339-the local society was narrow , but , instead of saying , " Does that very much matter ? "[198-cecil] [he]198-cecil rebelled , and tried to substitute for it [the society [he]198-cecil called broad]1340-the society he called broad . [He]198-cecil did not realize that [Lucy]116-lucy had consecrated [her]116-lucy environment by the thousand little civilities that create a tenderness in time , and that though [her]116-lucy eyes saw its defects , [her]116-lucy heart refused to despise it entirely . Nor did [he]198-cecil realize a more important point -- that if [she]116-lucy was too great for [this society]1341-this society , [she]116-lucy was too great for [all society]1342-all society , and had reached the stage where personal intercourse would alone satisfy [her]116-lucy . [A rebel [she]116-lucy was , but not of the kind [he]198-cecil understood]1343-a rebel she was , but not of the kind he understood -- [a rebel who desired , not [a wider dwelling - room]1345-a wider dwelling - room , but equality beside [the man [she]116-lucy loved]1346-the man she loved]1344-a rebel who desired , not a wider dwelling - room , but equality beside the man she loved . For [Italy]11-italy was offering [her]116-lucy the most priceless of all possessions -- [her]116-lucy own soul .

Playing bumble - puppy with [Minnie Beebe]225-minnie , [niece to [the rector]1348-the rector , and aged thirteen]1347-niece to the rector , and aged thirteen -- an ancient and most honourable game , which consists in striking tennis - balls high into the air , so that they fall over the net and immoderately bounce ; some hit [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch ; others are lost . The sentence is confused , but the better illustrates [Lucy]116-lucy 's state of mind , for [she]116-lucy was trying to talk to [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe at the same time .

" Oh , it has been such a nuisance -- first [he]198-cecil , then [they]2818-they -- [no one]2143-no one knowing what [they]2818-they wanted , and [everyone]2142-everyone so tiresome . "[116-lucy]

[Freddy]124-freddy possessed to a high degree the power of lashing [little girls]1353-little girls to fury , and in half a minute [he]124-freddy had transformed [Minnie]225-minnie from [a well - mannered child]1354-a well - mannered child into a howling wilderness . " [Emerson]150-the miss alans , [Freddy]2831-freddy ? Do [you]116-lucy know what Emersons [they]143-the emersons are ? "[1367-most young people]

" [I]124-freddy do n't know whether [they]143-the emersons 're [any Emersons]2832-any emersons , "[124-freddy] retorted [Freddy]124-freddy , who was democratic . " [I]1367-most young people trust [they]143-the emersons are [the right sort of person]2833-the right sort of person . Chapter XI : In [[Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse 's Well - Appointed [Flat]74-flat

[The Comic Muse]2871-the comic muse]73-mrs. vyse 's well - appointed flat the comic muse , though able to look after [her]2871-the comic muse own interests , did not disdain the assistance of [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse . [His]1395-he idea of bringing [the Emersons]143-the emersons to [Windy Corner]6-windy corner struck [her]2871-the comic muse as decidedly good , and [she]2871-the comic muse carried through the negotiations without a hitch . [Sir Harry Otway]135-sir harry signed the agreement , met [Mr. Emerson]150-the miss alans , who was duly disillusioned . [The Miss Alans]150-the miss alans were duly offended , and wrote a dignified letter to [Lucy]116-lucy , whom [they]236-the comic muse and of truth held responsible for the failure . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe planned pleasant moments for [the new - comers]315-the new - comers , and told [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch that [Freddy]124-freddy must call on [them]315-the new - comers as soon as [they]315-the new - comers arrived . Indeed , so ample was [the Muse]236-the comic muse and of truth 's equipment that [she]2871-the comic muse permitted [Mr. Harris]237-mr. harris , never [a very robust criminal]1402-a very robust criminal , to droop [his]237-mr. harris head , to be forgotten , and to die .

[Lucy]116-lucy -- to descend from [bright heaven]1403-bright heaven to [earth]1219-earth , whereon there are shadows because [there are hills]1405-there are hills -- [Lucy]116-lucy was at first plunged into despair , but settled after a little thought that it did not matter the very least . Now that [she]116-lucy was engaged , [the Emersons]143-the emersons would scarcely insult [her]116-lucy and were welcome into [the neighbourhood]2406-the neighbourhood . And [Cecil]198-cecil was welcome to bring whom [he]198-cecil would into [the neighbourhood]2406-the neighbourhood . Therefore [Cecil]198-cecil was welcome to bring [the Emersons]143-the emersons into [the neighbourhood]2406-the neighbourhood . But , as [I]0-i say , this took a little thinking , and -- so illogical are [girls]2606-girls -- the event remained rather greater and rather more dreadful than it should have done . [She]116-lucy was glad that a visit to [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse now fell due ; [the tenants]1410-the tenants moved into [Cissie Villa]209-cissie villa while [she]116-lucy was safe in [the London flat]1411-the london flat .

" [Cecil]198-cecil -- [Cecil]198-cecil darling , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy whispered the evening [she]116-lucy arrived , and crept into [his]198-cecil arms .

Several days passed . Then [she]116-lucy had a letter from [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett . A coolness had sprung up between [the two cousins]393-the two cousins , and [they]393-the two cousins had not corresponded since [they]393-the two cousins parted in August . " [L. M. Honeychurch]240-l. m. honeychurch . "[116-lucy]

Secrecy has this disadvantage : [we]1421-we lose the sense of proportion ; [we]1421-we can not tell whether [our]1421-we secret is important or not . Were [Lucy]116-lucy and [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin closeted with a great thing which would destroy [Cecil]198-cecil 's life if [he]198-cecil discovered it , or with a little thing which [he]198-cecil would laugh at ? [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett suggested the former . Perhaps [she]115-miss bartlett was right . It had become a great thing now . Left to [herself]116-lucy , [Lucy]116-lucy would have told [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother and [[her]116-lucy lover]1374-her lover ingenuously , and it would have remained a little thing . " [Emerson]150-the miss alans , not [Harris]237-mr. harris "[1426-some beautiful lady who had smitten his heart at school] ; it was only that a few weeks ago . But [her]116-lucy body behaved so ridiculously that [she]116-lucy stopped .

[She]116-lucy and [[her]116-lucy secret]1428-her secret stayed ten days longer in [the deserted Metropolis]1429-the deserted metropolis visiting the scenes [they]1425-they were to know so well later on . It did [her]116-lucy no harm , [Cecil]198-cecil thought , to learn the framework of society , while society itself was absent on [the golf - links]1430-the golf - links or [the moors]1431-the moors . The weather was cool , and it did [her]116-lucy no harm . In spite of the season , [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse managed to scrape together a dinner - party consisting entirely of [the grandchildren of [famous people]1433-famous people]1432-the grandchildren of famous people . The food was poor , but the talk had a witty weariness that impressed [the girl]332-the girl . [One]2092-one was tired of everything , it seemed . [One]1436-one launched into enthusiasms only to collapse gracefully , and pick [oneself]1436-one up amid sympathetic laughter . In this atmosphere the Pension [Bertolini]113-the bertolini and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner appeared equally crude , and [Lucy]116-lucy saw that [her]116-lucy [London]1-london career would estrange [her]116-lucy a little from all that [she]116-lucy had loved in the past .

[The grandchildren]1437-the grandchildren asked [her]332-the girl to play the piano .

[She]332-the girl played [Schumann]241-schumann . " Now some [Beethoven]152-beethoven "[198-cecil] called [Cecil]198-cecil , when the querulous beauty of the music had died . [She]332-the girl shook [her]332-the girl head and played [Schumann]241-schumann again . The melody rose , unprofitably magical . It broke ; it was resumed broken , not marching once from the cradle to the grave . The sadness of the incomplete -- the sadness that is often Life , but should never be Art -- throbbed in its disjected phrases , and made the nerves of [the audience]534-the audience throb . Not thus had [she]332-the girl played on the little draped piano at [the Bertolini]113-the bertolini , and " Too much [Schumann]241-schumann "[332-the girl] was not the remark that [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe had passed to [himself]119-mr. beebe when [she]332-the girl returned .

When [the guests]1439-the guests were gone , and [Lucy]116-lucy had gone to bed , [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse paced up and down [the drawing - room]385-the drawing - room , discussing [her]172-mrs. vyse little party with [[her]172-mrs. vyse son]2466-her son . [Mrs. Vyse]172-mrs. vyse was [a nice woman]1442-a nice woman , but [her]172-mrs. vyse personality , like many another 's , had been swamped by [London]1-london , for it needs a strong head to live among [many people]1443-many people . The too vast orb of [her]172-mrs. vyse fate had crushed [her]172-mrs. vyse ; and [she]172-mrs. vyse had seen too many seasons , too [many cities]1444-many cities , too many [men]2100-men , for [her]172-mrs. vyse abilities , and even with [Cecil]198-cecil [she]172-mrs. vyse was mechanical , and behaved as if [he]198-cecil was not [one son]1446-one son , but , so to speak , [a filial crowd]1447-a filial crowd .

Chapter XII : [Twelfth Chapter]79-twelfth chapter

It was a Saturday afternoon , gay and brilliant after abundant rains , and the spirit of youth dwelt in it , though the season was now autumn . All that was gracious triumphed . As [the motorcars]1457-the motorcars passed through [Summer Street]2663-summer street [they]1457-the motorcars raised only a little dust , and [their]1457-the motorcars stench was soon dispersed by the wind and replaced by the scent of the wet birches or of [the pines]1459-the pines . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , at leisure for life 's amenities , leant over [his]119-mr. beebe Rectory gate . [Freddy]1460-freddy leant by [him]119-mr. beebe , smoking a pendant pipe .

" Suppose [we]2924-we go and hinder [those new people]2925-those new people opposite for a little . "[119-mr. beebe]

" M'm . "[119-mr. beebe]

" [They]2925-those new people might amuse [you]119-mr. beebe . "[119-mr. beebe]

[Freddy]124-freddy , whom [[his]124-freddy fellow - creatures]1461-his fellow - creatures never amused , suggested that [the new people]1462-the new people might be feeling a bit busy , and so on , since [they]1462-the new people had only just moved in .

" [I]119-mr. beebe suggested [we]2924-we should hinder [them]1462-the new people , "[119-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe . " [They]2925-those new people are worth it . "[119-mr. beebe] Unlatching the gate , [he]119-mr. beebe sauntered over the triangular green to [Cissie Villa]209-cissie villa . " Hullo ! A grave voice replied , " Hullo ! "[119-mr. beebe]

" [I]119-mr. beebe 've brought [someone]1081-someone to see [you]119-mr. beebe . "[119-mr. beebe]

[The passage]1083-the passage was blocked by a wardrobe , which [the removal men]1464-the removal men had failed to carry up the stairs . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe edged round [it]1465-it with difficulty . [The sitting - room]1466-the sitting - room itself was blocked with books .

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe felt bound to assist [[his]119-mr. beebe young friend]1480-his young friend , and led the way out of [the house]884-the house and into [the pine - woods]841-the pine - woods . " And what a coincidence that [you]118-george should meet [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse ! Did [you]118-george realize that [you]118-george would find all the Pension [Bertolini]113-the bertolini down here ? "[335-the clergyman]

" Though , as a matter of fact , coincidences are much rarer than [we]2971-we suppose . For example , it is n't purely coincidentally that [you]118-george are here now , when [one]2092-one comes to reflect . "[335-the clergyman]

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe slid away from such heavy treatment of the subject . But [he]119-mr. beebe was infinitely tolerant of [the young]1077-the young , and had no desire to snub [George]118-george .

" Here [we]1488-we are ! "[124-freddy] called [Freddy]124-freddy .

" Oh , good ! "[119-mr. beebe] exclaimed [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , mopping [his]119-mr. beebe brow .

" In there 's [the pond]2977-the pond . [I]119-mr. beebe wish it was bigger , "[119-mr. beebe] [he]119-mr. beebe added apologetically .

[They]1488-we climbed down a slippery bank of pine - needles . There lay [the pond]2977-the pond , set in [its]2977-the pond little alp of green -- only a pond , but large enough to contain [the human body]1490-the human body , and pure enough to reflect the sky . On account of the rains , the waters had flooded the surrounding grass , which showed like a beautiful emerald path , tempting these feet towards [the central pool]1491-the central pool .

" It 's distinctly successful , as ponds go , "[119-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe . " No apologies are necessary for [the pond]2977-the pond . "[119-mr. beebe]

[George]118-george sat down where the ground was dry , and drearily unlaced [his]118-george boots .

" Are n't those masses of willow - herb splendid ? [I]119-mr. beebe love willow - herb in seed . What 's the name of this aromatic plant ? "[119-mr. beebe]

[No one]2143-no one knew , or seemed to care .

" These abrupt changes of vegetation -- this little spongeous tract of water plants , and on either side of it all the growths are tough or brittle -- heather , bracken , hurts , pines . Very charming , very charming . "[119-mr. beebe]

" [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , are n't [you]119-mr. beebe bathing ? "[124-freddy] called [Freddy]124-freddy , as [he]124-freddy stripped [himself]124-freddy .

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe thought [he]124-freddy was not .

" Water 's wonderful ! "[124-freddy] cried [Freddy]124-freddy , prancing in .

" Water 's water , "[118-george] murmured [George]118-george . " Apooshoo , kouf . "[119-mr. beebe]

[Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , who was hot , and who always acquiesced where possible , looked around [him]119-mr. beebe . [He]119-mr. beebe could detect [no parishioners]1502-no parishioners except the pine - trees , rising up steeply on all sides , and gesturing to each other against the blue . How glorious it was ! The world of [motor - cars]1503-motor - cars and [rural Deans]81-rural deans receded inimitably . [Water]82-water , sky , evergreens , a wind -- these things not even the seasons can touch , and surely they lie beyond the intrusion of [man]2279-man ?

" [I]2517-the other may as well wash too "[2517-the other] ; and soon [his]2517-the other garments made a third little pile on the sward , and [he]2517-the other too asserted the wonder of [the water]1302-the water .

It was ordinary water , nor was there very much of it , and , as [Freddy]124-freddy said , it reminded one of swimming in a salad . [The three gentlemen]1506-the three gentlemen rotated in [the pool]2806-the pool breast high , after the fashion of [the nymphs in [Gotterdammerung]83-gotterdammerung]1508-the nymphs in gotterdammerung . But either because the rains had given a freshness or because the sun was shedding a most glorious heat , or because [two of [the gentlemen]1510-the gentlemen]1509-two of the gentlemen were young in years and [the third young in spirit]1511-the third young in spirit -- for some reason or other a change came over [them]1506-the three gentlemen , and [they]1506-the three gentlemen forgot [Italy]11-italy and [Botany]249-botany and [Fate]182-fate . [They]1506-the three gentlemen began to play . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe and [Freddy]124-freddy splashed [each other]628-each other . [He]118-george was quiet : [they]1506-the three gentlemen feared [they]1506-the three gentlemen had offended [him]118-george . Then [all the forces of youth]1513-all the forces of youth burst out . " Race [you]118-george round it , then , "[124-freddy] cried [Freddy]124-freddy , and [they]1506-the three gentlemen raced in the sunshine , and [George]118-george took a short cut and dirtied [his]118-george shins , and had to bathe a second time . Then [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe consented to run -- a memorable sight .

[They]1506-the three gentlemen ran to get dry , [they]1506-the three gentlemen bathed to get cool , [they]1506-the three gentlemen played at being [Indians]250-indians in the willow - herbs and in the bracken , [they]1506-the three gentlemen bathed to get clean . That evening and all that night the water ran away . On the morrow [the pool]2806-the pool had shrunk to its old size and lost [its]2806-the pool glory . It had been a call to the blood and to the relaxed will , [a passing benediction whose influence did not pass]1531-a passing benediction whose influence did not pass , a holiness , a spell , a momentary chalice for youth .

Chapter XIII : How [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett 's Boiler Was So Tiresome

How often had [Lucy]116-lucy rehearsed this bow , this interview ! But [she]116-lucy had always rehearsed them indoors , and with certain accessories , which surely [we]1532-we have a right to assume . Who could foretell that [she]116-lucy and [George]118-george would meet in the rout of a civilization , amidst an army of coats and collars and boots that lay wounded over [the sunlit earth]1533-the sunlit earth ? [She]116-lucy had imagined [a young Mr. Emerson]150-the miss alans , who might be shy or morbid or indifferent or furtively impudent . [She]116-lucy was prepared for all of these . But [she]116-lucy had never imagined one who would be happy and greet [her]116-lucy with the shout of the morning star .

Indoors [herself]116-lucy , partaking of tea with [old Mrs. Butterworth]136-old mrs. butterworth , [she]116-lucy reflected that it is impossible to foretell the future with any degree of accuracy , that it is impossible to rehearse life . A fault in the scenery , a face in [the audience]534-the audience , an irruption of [the audience]534-the audience on to the stage , and all [our]1532-we carefully planned gestures mean nothing , or mean too much . " [I]116-lucy will bow , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy had thought . " [I]116-lucy will not shake hands with [him]198-cecil . That will be just the proper thing . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy had bowed -- but to whom ? [To gods]1536-to gods , to [heroes]2554-heroes , to the nonsense of [school - girls]1538-school - girls ! [She]116-lucy had bowed across the rubbish that cumbers [the world]2106-the world .

So ran [her]116-lucy thoughts , while [her]116-lucy faculties were busy with [Cecil]198-cecil . It was another of those dreadful engagement calls . [Mrs. Butterworth]136-old mrs. butterworth had wanted to see [him]198-cecil , and [he]198-cecil did not want to be seen . [He]198-cecil did not want to hear about hydrangeas , why [they]1540-they change [their]1540-they colour at [the seaside]1541-the seaside . [He]198-cecil did not want to join the C. O. S. When cross [he]198-cecil was always elaborate , and made long , clever answers where " Yes "[198-cecil] or " No "[198-cecil] would have done . [Lucy]116-lucy soothed [him]198-cecil and tinkered at the conversation in a way that promised well for [their]1542-their married peace . [No one]2143-no one is perfect , and surely it is wiser to discover the imperfections before wedlock . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , indeed , though not in word , had taught [the girl]332-the girl that this [our]1542-their life contains nothing satisfactory . [Lucy]116-lucy , though [she]116-lucy disliked [the teacher]527-the teacher , regarded the teaching as profound , and applied it to [[her]116-lucy lover]1374-her lover .

" [Lucy]116-lucy , "[450-her mother] said [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother , when [they]1542-their got [home]381-home , " is anything the matter with [Cecil]198-cecil ? "[450-her mother]

The question was ominous ; up till now [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch had behaved with charity and restraint .

" Since [Cecil]198-cecil came back from [London]1-london , nothing appears to please [him]198-cecil . [The two civilizations]1549-the two civilizations had clashed -- [Cecil]198-cecil hinted that [they]1549-the two civilizations might -- and [she]116-lucy was dazzled and bewildered , as though the radiance that lies behind all civilization had blinded [her]116-lucy eyes . Good taste and bad taste were only catchwords , garments of diverse cut ; and music itself dissolved to a whisper through pine - trees , where the song is not distinguishable from the comic song .

[She]116-lucy remained in much embarrassment , while [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch changed [her]154-mrs. honeychurch frock for dinner ; and every now and then [she]154-mrs. honeychurch said a word , and made things no better . There was no concealing the fact , [Cecil]198-cecil had meant to be supercilious , and [he]198-cecil had succeeded . And [Lucy]116-lucy -- [she]116-lucy knew not why -- wished that the trouble could have come at any other time .

" Go and dress , [dear]2102-dear ; [you]2102-dear 'll be late . "[116-lucy]

[She]116-lucy obeyed , but loitered disconsolately at the landing window . [It]1550-it faced north , so there was little view , and no view of the sky . [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch might have flamed out . [She]154-mrs. honeychurch did not . "[154-mrs. honeychurch] And , though nothing is perfect , [Lucy]116-lucy felt for the moment that [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother and [Windy Corner]6-windy corner and [the Weald]28-the weald in the declining sun were perfect .

So the grittiness went out of life . It generally did at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . At the last minute , when the social machine was clogged hopelessly , [one member or other of [the family]2634-the family]1562-one member or other of the family poured in a drop of oil . Chapter XIV : How [Lucy]116-lucy Faced the External Situation Bravely

Of course [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett accepted . And , equally of course , [she]115-miss bartlett felt sure that [she]115-miss bartlett would prove a nuisance , and begged to be given [an inferior spare room]1586-an inferior spare room -- something with no view , anything . [Her]115-miss bartlett love to [Lucy]116-lucy . And , equally of course , [George Emerson]118-george could come to tennis on the Sunday week .

[Lucy]116-lucy faced the situation bravely , though , like most of [us]1587-us , [she]116-lucy only faced the situation that encompassed [her]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy never gazed inwards . If at times strange images rose from the depths , [she]116-lucy put them down to nerves . When [Cecil]198-cecil brought [the Emersons]143-the emersons to [Summer Street]5-summer street , it had upset [her]116-lucy nerves . [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett would burnish up past foolishness , and this might upset [her]116-lucy nerves . [She]116-lucy was nervous at night . When [she]116-lucy talked to [George]118-george -- [they]1588-they met again almost immediately at [the Rectory]2109-the rectory -- [his]118-george voice moved [her]116-lucy deeply , and [she]116-lucy wished to remain near [him]118-george . How dreadful if [she]116-lucy really wished to remain near [him]118-george ! Of course , the wish was due to nerves , which love to play such perverse tricks upon [us]1590-us . Once [she]116-lucy had suffered from " things that came out of nothing and meant [she]116-lucy did n't know what . "[116-lucy] Now [Cecil]198-cecil had explained psychology to [her]116-lucy one wet afternoon , and all the troubles of youth in [an unknown world]1591-an unknown world could be dismissed .

It is obvious enough for [the reader]1592-the reader to conclude , " [She]116-lucy loves [young Emerson]118-george . "[1593-a reader in lucy 's place] [A reader in [Lucy]116-lucy 's place]1593-a reader in lucy 's place would not find it obvious . Life is easy to chronicle , but bewildering to practice , and [we]1590-us welcome " nerves "[1592-the reader] or any other shibboleth that will cloak [our]1590-us personal desire . [She]116-lucy loved [Cecil]198-cecil ; [George]118-george made [her]116-lucy nervous ; will [the reader]1592-the reader explain to [her]116-lucy that the phrases should have been reversed ?

But the external situation -- [she]116-lucy will face that bravely .

The meeting at [the Rectory]2109-the rectory had passed off well enough . Standing between [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe and [Cecil]198-cecil , [she]116-lucy had made a few temperate allusions to [Italy]11-italy , and [George]118-george had replied . [She]116-lucy was anxious to show that [she]116-lucy was not shy , and was glad that [he]118-george did not seem shy either .

" [A nice fellow]3054-a nice fellow , "[119-mr. beebe] said [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe afterwards " [He]3054-a nice fellow will work off [his]3054-a nice fellow crudities in time . [Lucy]116-lucy said , " [He]3054-a nice fellow seems in better spirits . [He]3054-a nice fellow laughs more . "[116-lucy]

" Yes , "[335-the clergyman] replied [the clergyman]335-the clergyman . " [He]3054-a nice fellow is waking up . "[335-the clergyman]

That was all . But , as the week wore on , more of [her]116-lucy defences fell , and [she]116-lucy entertained an image that had physical beauty . In spite of the clearest directions , [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett contrived to bungle [her]116-lucy arrival . [She]116-lucy was due at [the South - Eastern station]1597-the south - eastern station at [Dorking]27-dorking , whither [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch drove to meet [her]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy arrived at [the [London]1-london and [Brighton]86-brighton station]1598-the london and brighton station , and had to hire [a cab]861-a cab up . [She]116-lucy escaped into [the kitchen]1621-the kitchen . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett 's sudden transitions were too uncanny . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett was in [the drawing - room]385-the drawing - room , gazing at the photograph of [St. John ascending]144-st. john , which had been framed .

" Oh , no , [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett , "[332-the girl] said [the girl]332-the girl , entering the battle . " [George Emerson]118-george is all right , and what other source is there ? "[332-the girl]

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett considered . " For instance , [the driver]2196-the driver . [I]115-miss bartlett saw [him]2196-the driver looking through the bushes at [you]116-lucy , remember [he]2196-the driver had a violet between [his]2196-the driver teeth . "[115-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]116-lucy shuddered a little . " [We]3078-we shall get the silly affair on [our]3078-we nerves if [we]3078-we are n't careful . How could [a Florentine cab - driver]3079-a florentine cab - driver ever get hold of [Cecil]198-cecil ? "[116-lucy]

" [We]3078-we must think of every possibility . "[332-the girl]

" Oh , it 's all right . "[116-lucy]

" Or perhaps [old Mr. Emerson]118-george knows . In fact , [he]118-george is certain to know . "[332-the girl]

" [I]116-lucy do n't care if [he]118-george does . [I]116-lucy was grateful to [you]116-lucy for [your]116-lucy letter , but even if the news does get round , [I]116-lucy think [I]116-lucy can trust [Cecil]198-cecil to laugh at it . "[116-lucy]

" To contradict it ? "[332-the girl]

" Very well , [dear]2102-dear , [you]116-lucy know best . Perhaps [gentlemen]2176-gentlemen are different to what [they]2176-gentlemen were when [I]1625-him was young . [Ladies]668-ladies are certainly different . "[1625-him]

" Now , [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett ! "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy struck at [her]116-lucy playfully . " [You]115-miss bartlett kind , anxious thing . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett sighed " [I]115-miss bartlett am no match for [you]116-lucy in conversation , [dearest]2116-dearest . [You]116-lucy will never forgive [me]115-miss bartlett . "[115-miss bartlett]

" Shall [we]3084-we go out , then . [They]3085-they will smash all the china if [we]3084-we do n't . "[1625-him]

For the air rang with the shrieks of [Minnie]225-minnie , who was being scalped with a teaspoon .

" [Dear]2102-dear , one moment -- [we]3084-we may not have this chance for a chat again . Have [you]116-lucy seen [the young one]3087-the young one yet ? "[115-miss bartlett]

"[115-miss bartlett]

" Once [a cad]3090-a cad , always [a cad]3090-a cad . That is [my]115-miss bartlett poor opinion . "[115-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]116-lucy paused . " [Cecil]198-cecil said one day -- and [I]116-lucy thought it so profound -- that there are two kinds of cads -- [the conscious]3093-the conscious and the subconscious . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy paused again , to be sure of doing justice to [Cecil]198-cecil 's profundity . Through the window [she]116-lucy saw [Cecil]198-cecil [himself]198-cecil , turning over the pages of a novel . It was a new one from [[Smith]254-smith 's library]1626-smith 's library . " Once [a cad]3090-a cad , always [a cad]3090-a cad , "[115-miss bartlett] droned [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett .

" What [I]1629-i mean by subconscious is that [Emerson]118-george lost [his]118-george head . [I]1629-i fell into all those violets , and [he]118-george was silly and surprised . [I]1629-i do n't think [we]3096-we ought to blame [him]118-george very much . [Papa]255-papa was to do with journalism , but is rheumatic and has retired . [There]337-there ! Now for [the garden]2219-the garden . "[1629-i] [She]1629-i took hold of [[her]1629-i guest]1630-her guest by the arm . " Suppose [we]3108-we do n't talk about this silly Italian business any more . [We]3108-we want [you]1630-her guest to have a nice restful visit at [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , with no worriting . "[1629-i]

[Lucy]116-lucy thought this rather a good speech . [The reader]1592-the reader may have detected an unfortunate slip in it . Whether [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett detected the slip [one]1632-one can not say , for it is impossible to penetrate into the minds of [elderly people]1633-elderly people . [She]115-miss bartlett might have spoken further , but [they]1633-elderly people were interrupted by the entrance of [[her]115-miss bartlett hostess]1634-her hostess . Explanations took place , and in the midst of them [Lucy]116-lucy escaped , the images throbbing a little more vividly in [her]116-lucy brain .

Chapter XV : The Disaster Within

The Sunday after [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett 's arrival was a glorious day , like most of the days of that year . In [the Weald]28-the weald , autumn approached , breaking up the green monotony of summer , touching [the parks]1635-the parks with the grey bloom of mist , the beech - trees with russet , the oak - trees with gold . Up on [the heights]1636-the heights , battalions of black pines witnessed the change , [themselves]1637-themselves unchangeable . [Either country]1638-either country was spanned by a cloudless sky , and in either arose the tinkle of church bells .

[The garden of [Windy Corners]88-windy corners]1639-the garden of windy corners was deserted except for a red book , which lay sunning itself upon [the gravel path]1640-the gravel path . From [the house]884-the house came incoherent sounds , as of [females preparing for worship]1642-females preparing for worship . " [The men]434-the men say [they]434-the men wo n't go"--"Well[0-i] , [I]0-i do n't blame them"--Minnie says , "[115-miss bartlett] need [she]115-miss bartlett go?"--"Tell [her]115-miss bartlett , no nonsense"--"Anne[115-miss bartlett] ! [Mary]213-mary ! Hook [me]0-i behind!"--"Dearest [Lucia]165-lucia , may [I]115-miss bartlett trespass upon [you]165-lucia for a pin ? "[115-miss bartlett] For [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett had announced that [she]115-miss bartlett at all events was one for [church]532-church .

The sun rose higher on its journey , guided , not by [Phaethon]180-phaethon , but by [Apollo]256-apollo , competent , unswerving , divine . Its rays fell on [the ladies]302-the ladies whenever [they]302-the ladies advanced towards the bedroom windows ; on [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe down at [Summer Street]5-summer street as [he]119-mr. beebe smiled over a letter from [Miss Catharine Alan]146-miss alan ; on [George Emerson]118-george cleaning [[his]118-george father]350-his father 's boots ; and lastly , to complete the catalogue of memorable things , on the red book mentioned previously . [The ladies]302-the ladies move , [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe moves , [George]118-george moves , and movement may engender shadow . But this book lies motionless , to be caressed all the morning by the sun and to raise its covers slightly , as though acknowledging the caress .

[Presently Lucy]116-lucy steps out of [the drawing - room]385-the drawing - room window . [Her]115-miss bartlett new cerise dress has been a failure , and makes [her]115-miss bartlett look tawdry and wan . At [her]115-miss bartlett throat is a garnet brooch , on [her]115-miss bartlett finger a ring set with rubies -- an engagement ring . [Her]115-miss bartlett eyes are bent to the Weald . [She]115-miss bartlett frowns a little -- not in anger , but as [a brave child]1648-a brave child frowns when [he]1648-a brave child is trying not to cry . In all that expanse no human eye is looking at [her]115-miss bartlett , and [she]115-miss bartlett may frown unrebuked and measure the spaces that yet survive between [Apollo]256-apollo and [the western hills]1649-the western hills .

" [Lucy]116-lucy ! [Lucy]116-lucy ! What 's that book ? Who 's been taking a book out of the shelf and leaving it about to spoil ? "[115-miss bartlett]

" It 's only the library book that [Cecil]198-cecil 's been reading . "[115-miss bartlett]

" But pick it up , and do n't stand idling there like a flamingo . "[115-miss bartlett]

[Lucy]116-lucy picked up the book and glanced at the title listlessly , Under a Loggia . [She]116-lucy no longer read novels [herself]116-lucy , devoting all [her]116-lucy spare time to solid literature in the hope of catching [Cecil]198-cecil up . It was dreadful how little [she]116-lucy knew , and even when [she]116-lucy thought [she]116-lucy knew a thing , like [the Italian painters]1650-the italian painters , [she]116-lucy found [she]116-lucy had forgotten it . Only this morning [she]116-lucy had confused [Francesco Francia]257-francesco francia with [Piero della Francesca]258-piero della francesca , and [Cecil]198-cecil had said , " What ! [you]116-lucy are n't forgetting [[your]116-lucy [Italy]11-italy]3110-your italy already ? "[198-cecil] And this too had lent anxiety to [her]116-lucy eyes when [she]116-lucy saluted the dear view and [the dear garden]1651-the dear garden in the foreground , and above them , scarcely conceivable elsewhere , the dear sun .

" [Lucy]116-lucy -- have [you]116-lucy a sixpence for [Minnie]225-minnie and a shilling for [yourself]116-lucy ? "[198-cecil]

[She]116-lucy hastened in to [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother , who was rapidly working [herself]450-her mother into a Sunday fluster .

" It 's a special collection -- [I]198-cecil forget what for . [I]198-cecil do beg , no vulgar clinking in the plate with halfpennies ; see that [Minnie]225-minnie has a nice bright sixpence . Where is [the child]506-the child ? [Minnie]225-minnie ! That book 's all warped . ( Gracious , how plain [you]116-lucy look ! ) Put it under the Atlas to press . [Minnie]225-minnie ! "[198-cecil]

" Oh , [Mrs. Honeychurch--]259-mrs. honeychurch-- "[198-cecil] from [the upper regions]1653-the upper regions .

" [Minnie]225-minnie , do n't be late . Here comes the horse"--it[198-cecil] was always the horse , never [the carriage]869-the carriage . " Where 's [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett ? Run up and hurry [her]115-miss bartlett . Why is [she]115-miss bartlett so long ? [She]115-miss bartlett had nothing to do . [She]115-miss bartlett never brings anything but blouses . [Poor Charlotte]115-miss bartlett -- How [I]198-cecil do detest blouses ! [Minnie]225-minnie ! "[198-cecil]

Paganism is infectious -- more infectious than diphtheria or piety -- and [[the Rector]1348-the rector 's niece]1656-the rector 's niece was taken to [church]532-church protesting . As usual , [she]1656-the rector 's niece did n't see why . Why should n't [she]1656-the rector 's niece sit in the sun with [the young men]1658-the young men ? [The young men]1658-the young men , who had now appeared , mocked [her]1656-the rector 's niece with ungenerous words . [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch defended orthodoxy , and in the midst of the confusion [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , dressed in the very height of the fashion , came strolling down [the stairs]1660-the stairs .

" [Dear Marian]213-mary , [I]115-miss bartlett am very sorry , but [I]115-miss bartlett have no small change -- nothing but sovereigns and half crowns . Could [any one]352-any one give [me--]3113-me-- "[115-miss bartlett]

" Yes , easily . Jump in . Gracious [me]115-miss bartlett , how smart [you]1656-the rector 's niece look ! What a lovely frock ! [You]1656-the rector 's niece put [us]1662-they all to shame . "[115-miss bartlett]

" If [I]115-miss bartlett did not wear [my]115-miss bartlett best rags and tatters now , when should [I]115-miss bartlett wear them ? "[115-miss bartlett] said [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett reproachfully . [She]115-miss bartlett got into [the victoria]1232-the victoria and placed [herself]115-miss bartlett with [her]115-miss bartlett back to the horse . The necessary roar ensued , and then [they]1662-they drove off .

" Good - bye ! Be good ! "[198-cecil] called out [Cecil]198-cecil .

[Lucy]116-lucy bit [her]116-lucy lip , for the tone was sneering . On the subject of " [church]532-church and so on "[1662-they] [they]1662-they had had rather an unsatisfactory conversation . [He]198-cecil had said that [people]308-people ought to overhaul [themselves]308-people , and [she]116-lucy did not want to overhaul [herself]116-lucy ; [she]116-lucy did not know it was done . [Honest orthodoxy Cecil]198-cecil respected , but [he]198-cecil always assumed that honesty is the result of a spiritual crisis ; [he]198-cecil could not imagine it as a natural birthright , that might grow heavenward like flowers . All that [he]198-cecil said on this subject pained [her]116-lucy , though [he]198-cecil exuded tolerance from every pore ; somehow [the Emersons]143-the emersons were different .

[She]116-lucy saw [the Emersons]143-the emersons after [church]532-church . There was a line of [carriages]1665-carriages down [the road]409-the road , and [the Honeychurch vehicle]1667-the honeychurch vehicle happened to be opposite [Cissie Villa]209-cissie villa . To save time , [they]1668-they walked over the green to [it]209-cissie villa , and found [father]2671-father and [son]1670-son smoking in [the garden]2219-the garden .

" Introduce [me]450-her mother , "[450-her mother] said [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother . " Unless [the young man]348-the young man considers that [he]348-the young man knows [me]450-her mother already . "[450-her mother]

[He]198-cecil probably did ; but [Lucy]116-lucy ignored [the Sacred Lake]70-the sacred lake and introduced [them]1668-they formally . [Old Mr. Emerson]261-old mr. emerson claimed [her]116-lucy with much warmth , and said how glad [he]261-old mr. emerson was that [she]116-lucy was going to be married . [She]116-lucy said yes , [she]116-lucy was glad too ; and then , as [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett and [Minnie]225-minnie were lingering behind with [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , [she]116-lucy turned the conversation to a less disturbing topic , and asked [him]261-old mr. emerson how [he]261-old mr. emerson liked [[his]261-old mr. emerson new house]1673-his new house .

" Very much , "[261-old mr. emerson] [he]261-old mr. emerson replied , but there was a note of offence in [his]261-old mr. emerson voice ; [she]116-lucy had never known [him]261-old mr. emerson offended before . [He]261-old mr. emerson added : " [We]3116-we find , though , that [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans were coming , and that [we]3116-we have turned [them]3117-them out . [Women]262-women mind such a thing . [I]261-old mr. emerson am very much upset about it . "[261-old mr. emerson]

" [I]154-mrs. honeychurch believe that there was some misunderstanding , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch uneasily .

" [[Our]3116-we landlord]3118-our landlord was told that [we]3116-we should be [a different type of person]3119-a different type of person , "[118-george] said [George]118-george , who seemed disposed to carry the matter further . " [He]3118-our landlord thought [we]3116-we should be artistic . [He]3118-our landlord is disappointed . "[118-george]

" And [I]118-george wonder whether [we]3116-we ought to write to [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans and offer to give it up . What do [you]118-george think ? "[118-george] [He]118-george appealed to [Lucy]116-lucy .

" Oh , stop now [you]118-george have come , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy lightly . [She]116-lucy must avoid censuring [Cecil]198-cecil . For it was on [Cecil]198-cecil that the little episode turned , though [his]198-cecil name was never mentioned .

" So [George]118-george says . [He]118-george says that [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans must go to the wall . Yet it does seem so unkind . "[198-cecil]

" There is only a certain amount of kindness in [the world]2106-the world , "[118-george] said [George]118-george , watching the sunlight flash on the panels of [the passing carriages]1674-the passing carriages .

" Yes ! "[154-mrs. honeychurch] exclaimed [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch . " That 's exactly what [I]154-mrs. honeychurch say . Why all this twiddling and twaddling over [two Miss Alans]150-the miss alans ? "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" There is a certain amount of kindness , just as there is a certain amount of light , "[118-george] [he]118-george continued in measured tones . " [We]3121-we cast a shadow on something wherever [we]3121-we stand , and it is no good moving from place to place to save things ; because the shadow always follows . Choose a place where [you]3122-you wo n't do harm -- yes , choose a place where [you]3122-you wo n't do very much harm , and stand in it for all [you]3122-you are worth , facing the sunshine . "[118-george]

" Oh , [Mr. Emerson]118-george , [I]450-her mother see [you]118-george 're clever ! "[450-her mother]

" [Eh--]3123-eh-- ? "[118-george]

[George]118-george 's eyes laughed , and [Lucy]116-lucy suspected that [he]118-george and [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother would get on rather well .

" No , [I]118-george did n't , "[118-george] [he]118-george said . " [He]118-george behaved that way to [me]118-george . It is [his]118-george philosophy . Only [he]118-george starts life with it ; and [I]118-george have tried the Note of Interrogation first . "[118-george]

" What DO [you]118-george mean ? No , never mind what [you]118-george mean . Do n't explain . [He]118-george looks forward to seeing [you]118-george this afternoon . Do [you]118-george play tennis ? Do [you]118-george mind tennis on Sunday-- ? "[1677-she]

[He]1676-he thanked [her]1677-she , but the walk sounded rather far ; [he]1676-he could only potter about in these days .

[She]1677-she turned to [George]118-george : " And then [he]118-george wants to give up [[his]118-george house]3126-his house to [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans . "[1677-she]

" [I]118-george know , "[118-george] said [George]118-george , and put [his]118-george arm round [[his]118-george father]350-his father 's neck . [She]1677-she remembered that in all [his]118-george perversities [he]118-george had never spoken against affection .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett approached .

" [You]115-miss bartlett know [[our]3127-our cousin]3128-our cousin , [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] said [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch pleasantly . " [You]115-miss bartlett met [her]3128-our cousin with [[my]154-mrs. honeychurch daughter]3129-my daughter in [Florence]14-florence . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" Yes , indeed ! "[313-the old man] said [the old man]313-the old man , and made as if [he]313-the old man would come out of [the garden]2219-the garden to meet [the lady]1189-the lady . [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett promptly got into [the victoria]1232-the victoria . Thus entrenched , [she]115-miss bartlett emitted a formal bow . It was the pension [Bertolini]113-the bertolini again , the dining - table with the decanters of water and wine . It was the old , old battle of [the room with the view]1683-the room with the view .

[George]118-george did not respond to the bow . Like [any boy]1684-any boy , [he]118-george blushed and was ashamed ; [he]118-george knew that [the chaperon]1085-the chaperon remembered . [He]118-george said : " [I]118-george -- [I'll]118-george come up to tennis if [I]118-george can manage it , "[118-george] and went into [the house]884-the house . Perhaps anything that [he]313-the old man did would have pleased [Lucy]116-lucy , but [his]313-the old man awkwardness went straight to [her]116-lucy heart ; [men]2100-men were not [gods]2555-gods after all , but as human and as clumsy as [girls]2606-girls ; even [men]2100-men might suffer from unexplained desires , and need help . To one of [her]116-lucy upbringing , and of [her]116-lucy destination , the weakness of [men]2100-men was a truth unfamiliar , but [she]116-lucy had surmised it at [Florence]14-florence , when [George]118-george threw [her]116-lucy photographs into [the River Arno]49-the river arno .

" [George]118-george , do n't go , "[350-his father] cried [[his]118-george father]350-his father , who thought it a great treat for [people]308-people if [[his]350-his father son]319-his son would talk to [them]308-people . " [George]118-george has been in such good spirits today , and [I]350-his father am sure [he]118-george will end by coming up this afternoon . "[350-his father]

[Lucy]116-lucy caught [[her]116-lucy cousin]317-her cousin 's eye . Something in its mute appeal made [her]116-lucy reckless . " Yes , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said , raising [her]116-lucy voice , " [I]116-lucy do hope [he]118-george will . "[116-lucy] Then [she]116-lucy went to [the carriage]869-the carriage and murmured , " [The old man]313-the old man has n't been told ; [I]116-lucy knew it was all right . "[116-lucy] [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch followed [her]116-lucy , and [they]1697-they drove away .

Satisfactory that [Mr. Emerson]118-george had not been told of the [Florence]14-florence escapade ; yet [Lucy]116-lucy 's spirits should not have leapt up as if [she]116-lucy had sighted [the ramparts of heaven]1698-the ramparts of heaven . Satisfactory ; yet surely [she]116-lucy greeted it with disproportionate joy . All the way [home]381-home the horses ' hoofs sang a tune to [her]116-lucy : " [He]313-the old man has not told , [he]313-the old man has not told . "[116-lucy] [Her]116-lucy brain expanded the melody : " [He]313-the old man has not told [[his]313-the old man father]350-his father -- to whom [he]313-the old man tells all things . It was not an exploit . [He]313-the old man did not laugh at [me]116-lucy when [I]116-lucy had gone . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy raised [her]116-lucy hand to [her]116-lucy cheek . " [He]313-the old man does not love [me]116-lucy . No . How terrible if [he]313-the old man did ! But [he]313-the old man has not told . [He]313-the old man will not tell . "[116-lucy]

[She]116-lucy longed to shout the words : " It is all right . It 's a secret between [us]1700-us two for ever . [Cecil]198-cecil will never hear . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy was even glad that [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett had made [her]115-miss bartlett promise secrecy , that last dark evening at [Florence]14-florence , when [they]1700-us had knelt packing in [[his]1701-his room]1082-his room . The secret , big or little , was guarded .

[Only three English people]1703-only three english people knew of it in [the world]2106-the world . Thus [she]116-lucy interpreted [her]116-lucy joy . [She]116-lucy greeted [Cecil]198-cecil with unusual radiance , because [she]116-lucy felt so safe . As [he]198-cecil helped [her]116-lucy out of [the carriage]869-the carriage , [she]116-lucy said :

" [The Emersons]143-the emersons have been so nice . [George Emerson]118-george has improved enormously . "[198-cecil]

" How are [[my]198-cecil proteges]3132-my proteges ? "[198-cecil] asked [Cecil]198-cecil , who took no real interest in [them]1706-them , and had long since forgotten [his]198-cecil resolution to bring [them]1706-them to [Windy Corner]6-windy corner for educational purposes .

" [Proteges]3133-proteges ! "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy exclaimed with some warmth . For the only relationship which [Cecil]198-cecil conceived was feudal : that of [protector and protected]1707-protector and protected . [He]198-cecil had no glimpse of the comradeship after which [the girl]332-the girl 's soul yearned .

" [You]116-lucy shall see for [yourself]116-lucy how [[your]116-lucy proteges]3134-your proteges are . [George Emerson]118-george is coming up this afternoon . [He]118-george is [a most interesting man]3135-a most interesting man to talk to . Only don't-- "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy nearly said , " Do n't protect [him]118-george . "[116-lucy] But the bell was ringing for lunch , and , as often happened , [Cecil]198-cecil had paid no great attention to [her]116-lucy remarks . Charm , not argument , was to be [her]116-lucy forte .

Lunch was a cheerful meal . Generally [Lucy]116-lucy was depressed at meals . [Some one]2313-some one had to be soothed -- either [Cecil]198-cecil or [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett or [a Being not visible to the mortal eye]1710-a being not visible to the mortal eye -- [a Being who whispered to [her]116-lucy soul]1711-a being who whispered to her soul : " It will not last , this cheerfulness . "[1711-a being who whispered to her soul] But to - day [she]116-lucy felt [she]116-lucy had received a guarantee . [[Her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother would always sit there , [[her]116-lucy brother]834-her brother here . The sun , though it had moved a little since the morning , would never be hidden behind [the western hills]1649-the western hills . After luncheon [they]1715-they asked [her]116-lucy to play . [She]116-lucy had seen [Gluck]263-gluck 's Armide that year , and played from memory the music of [the enchanted garden]1716-the enchanted garden -- the music to which [Renaud]264-renaud approaches , beneath the light of an eternal dawn , the music that never gains , never wanes , but ripples for ever like [the tideless seas of fairyland]1717-the tideless seas of fairyland . Such music is not for the piano , and [[her]116-lucy audience]1718-her audience began to get restive , and [Cecil]198-cecil , sharing the discontent , called out : " Now play [us]1715-they the other garden -- the one in [Parsifal]89-parsifal . "[198-cecil]

[She]116-lucy closed the instrument .

" Not very dutiful , "[450-her mother] said [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother 's voice .

" Oh , [I]116-lucy had no idea ! "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy exclaimed , getting very red ; and then , without a word of greeting , [she]116-lucy reopened the piano . [Cecil]198-cecil should have the Parsifal , and anything else that [he]198-cecil liked .

[Lucy]116-lucy 's Sabbath was generally of this amphibious nature . [She]116-lucy kept it without hypocrisy in the morning , and broke it without reluctance in the afternoon . [Mr. Floyd]251-mr. floyd was [[her]116-lucy partner]1723-her partner . [She]116-lucy liked music , but how much better tennis seemed . How much better to run about in comfortable clothes than to sit at the piano and feel girt under the arms . Once more music appeared to [her]116-lucy the employment of [a child]1047-a child . Ah , how beautiful [the Weald]28-the weald looked ! Chapter two was found , and [she]116-lucy glanced at its opening sentences .

[She]116-lucy thought [she]116-lucy had gone mad .

[She]116-lucy heard [her]116-lucy voice saying : " It is n't worth reading -- it 's too silly to read -- [I]116-lucy never saw such rubbish -- it ought n't to be allowed to be printed . "[116-lucy]

[He]198-cecil took the book from [her]116-lucy .

[She]116-lucy led the way up [the garden]2219-the garden , [Cecil]198-cecil following [her]116-lucy , [George]118-george last . [She]116-lucy thought a disaster was averted . The book , as if it had not worked mischief enough , had been forgotten , and [Cecil]198-cecil must go back for it ; and [George]118-george , who loved passionately , must blunder against [her]116-lucy in [the narrow path]1750-the narrow path .

" No-- "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy gasped , and , for the second time , was kissed by [him]118-george .

Chapter XVI : Lying to [George]118-george

But [Lucy]116-lucy had developed since the spring . That is to say , [she]116-lucy was now better able to stifle the emotions of which the conventions and [the world]2106-the world disapprove . Though the danger was greater , [she]116-lucy was not shaken by deep sobs . [She]116-lucy said to [Cecil]198-cecil , " [I]116-lucy am not coming in to tea -- tell [mother]2108-mother -- [I]116-lucy must write some letters , "[116-lucy] and went up to [[her]116-lucy room]403-her room . Then [she]116-lucy prepared for action . Love felt and returned , love which [our]1754-our bodies exact and [our]1754-our hearts have transfigured , love which is the most real thing that [we]1754-our shall ever meet , reappeared now as [the world]2106-the world 's enemy , and [she]116-lucy must stifle it .

[She]116-lucy sent for [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett .

The contest lay not between love and duty . Perhaps there never is such a contest . It lay between [the real]1756-the real and [the pretended]1757-the pretended , and [Lucy]116-lucy 's first aim was to defeat [herself]116-lucy . As [her]116-lucy brain clouded over , as the memory of the views grew dim and the words of the book died away , [she]116-lucy returned to [her]116-lucy old shibboleth of nerves . [She]116-lucy " conquered [her]116-lucy breakdown . "[116-lucy] Tampering with the truth , [she]116-lucy forgot that the truth had ever been . Remembering that [she]116-lucy was engaged to [Cecil]198-cecil , [she]116-lucy compelled [herself]116-lucy to confused remembrances of [George]118-george ; [he]118-george was nothing to [her]116-lucy ; [he]118-george never had been anything ; [he]118-george had behaved abominably ; [she]116-lucy had never encouraged [him]118-george . "[198-cecil]

Chapter XVII : Lying to [Cecil]198-cecil

[He]198-cecil was bewildered . [He]198-cecil had nothing to say . [He]198-cecil was not even angry , but stood , with a glass of whiskey between [his]198-cecil hands , trying to think what had led [her]116-lucy to such a conclusion .

[She]116-lucy had chosen the moment before bed , when , in accordance with [their]1791-their bourgeois habit , [she]116-lucy always dispensed drinks to [the men]434-the men . [Freddy]1793-freddy and [Mr. Floyd]251-mr. floyd were sure to retire with [their]1791-their glasses , while [Cecil]198-cecil invariably lingered , sipping at [his]198-cecil while [she]116-lucy locked up the sideboard .

" [I]116-lucy am very sorry about it , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said ; " [I]116-lucy have carefully thought things over . [We]3273-we are too different . [I]116-lucy must ask [you]198-cecil to release [me]116-lucy , and try to forget that there ever was such [a foolish girl]3274-a foolish girl . "[116-lucy]

It was a suitable speech , but [she]116-lucy was more angry than sorry , and [her]116-lucy voice showed it .

" Different -- how -- how-- "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy have n't had a really good education , for one thing , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy continued , still on [her]116-lucy knees by the sideboard . " [My]116-lucy Italian trip came too late , and [I]116-lucy am forgetting all that [I]116-lucy learnt [there]337-there . [I]116-lucy shall never be able to talk to [[your]198-cecil friends]3276-your friends , or behave as [a wife of yours]3277-a wife of yours should . "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy do n't understand [you]198-cecil . [You]198-cecil are n't like [yourself]198-cecil . [You]198-cecil 're tired , [Lucy]116-lucy . "[116-lucy]

" Well , [you]198-cecil sound tired , as if something has worried [you]198-cecil . "[116-lucy]

" What if [I]116-lucy do ? It does n't prevent [me]116-lucy from realizing the truth . [I]116-lucy ca n't marry [you]198-cecil , and [you]198-cecil will thank [me]116-lucy for saying so some day . "[116-lucy]

" [You]198-cecil had that bad headache yesterday -- All right"--for[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy had exclaimed indignantly : " [I]116-lucy see it 's much more than headaches . "[1794-i]

It struck [her]116-lucy that [he]1794-i was not behaving so badly , and [her]116-lucy irritation increased . [She]116-lucy again desired a struggle , not a discussion . To bring on the crisis , [she]116-lucy said :

" There are days when [one]2092-one sees clearly , and this is one of them . Things must come to a breaking - point some time , and it happens to be to - day . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy developed this position . " Often before [I]116-lucy have wondered if [I]116-lucy was fitted for [[your]198-cecil wife]3281-your wife -- for instance , in [London]1-london ; and are [you]198-cecil fitted to be [[my]116-lucy husband]3282-my husband ? "[198-cecil]

[He]198-cecil began to walk up and down [the room]328-the room , and [she]1795-i grew more and more vexed at [his]198-cecil dignified behaviour . " [You]198-cecil do n't love [me]198-cecil , evidently . [I]198-cecil dare say [you]198-cecil are right not to . But it would hurt a little less if [I]198-cecil knew why . "[198-cecil]

" What do [you]1800-you mean by a new voice ? "[1799-she] [she]1799-she asked , seized with incontrollable anger .

[She]116-lucy watched [him]1805-his steal up - [stairs]1806-stairs , while the shadows from three banisters passed over [her]116-lucy face like the beat of wings . On [the landing]1807-the landing [he]1805-his paused strong in [his]1805-his renunciation , and gave [her]116-lucy a look of memorable beauty .
