[She]116-lucy could never marry . In the tumult of [her]116-lucy soul , that stood firm . [Cecil]198-cecil believed in [her]116-lucy ; [she]116-lucy must some day believe in [herself]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy must be [one of [the women whom [she]116-lucy had praised so eloquently , who care for liberty and not for [men]2100-men]1810-the women whom she had praised so eloquently , who care for liberty and not for men]1809-one of the women whom she had praised so eloquently , who care for liberty and not for men ; [she]116-lucy must forget that [George]118-george loved [her]116-lucy , that [George]118-george had been thinking through [her]116-lucy and gained [her]116-lucy this honourable release , that [George]118-george had gone away into -- what was it?--the darkness .

[She]116-lucy put out the lamp .

It did not do to think , nor , for the matter of that , to feel . [She]116-lucy gave up trying to understand [herself]116-lucy , and joined [the vast armies of [the benighted]1813-the benighted]1812-the vast armies of the benighted , who follow neither the heart nor the brain , and march to [their]1813-the benighted destiny by catch - words . [The armies]1814-the armies are full of [pleasant and pious folk]1815-pleasant and pious folk . But [they]1814-the armies have yielded to the only enemy that matters -- [the enemy within]1816-the enemy within . [They]1814-the armies have sinned against passion and truth , and vain will be [their]1814-the armies strife after virtue . As the years pass , [they]1814-the armies are censured . [Their]1814-the armies pleasantry and [their]1814-the armies piety show cracks , [their]1814-the armies wit becomes cynicism , [their]1814-the armies unselfishness hypocrisy ; [they]1814-the armies feel and produce discomfort wherever [they]1814-the armies go . [They]1814-the armies have sinned against [Eros]275-eros and against [Pallas Athene]276-pallas athene , and not by any heavenly intervention , but by the ordinary course of nature , [those allied deities]1817-those allied deities will be avenged .

[Lucy]116-lucy entered [this army]1818-this army when [she]116-lucy pretended to [George]118-george that [she]116-lucy did not love [him]118-george , and pretended to [Cecil]198-cecil that [she]116-lucy loved [no one]2143-no one . The night received [her]116-lucy , as it had received [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett thirty years before .

Chapter XVIII : Lying to [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe , [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , [Freddy]124-freddy , and [The Servants

Windy Corner]1820-the servants windy corner lay , not on [the summit of [the ridge]1822-the ridge]1821-the summit of the ridge , but a few hundred feet down [the southern slope]1823-the southern slope , at the springing of one of the great buttresses that supported [the hill]894-the hill . On either side of [it]1825-it was [a shallow ravine]1826-a shallow ravine , filled with ferns and pine - trees , and down [the ravine on the left]1827-the ravine on the left ran [the highway]1828-the highway into [the Weald]28-the weald .

[Whenever Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe crossed [the ridge]1822-the ridge and caught sight of these noble dispositions of [the earth]2465-the earth , and , poised in the middle of [them]1831-them , [Windy Corner,--he]277-windy corner,--he laughed . The situation was so glorious , [the house]884-the house so commonplace , not to say impertinent . [The late Mr. Honeychurch]224-mr. honeychurch had affected [the cube]1833-the cube , because [it]1833-the cube gave [him]224-mr. honeychurch the most accommodation for [his]224-mr. honeychurch money , and the only addition made by [[his]224-mr. honeychurch widow]1834-his widow had been a small turret , shaped like a rhinoceros ' horn , where [she]1834-his widow could sit in wet weather and watch [the carts]1835-the carts going up and down [the road]409-the road . So impertinent -- and yet [the house]884-the house " did , "[1842-expensive architects] for [it]884-the house was the home of people who loved [[their]1838-their surroundings]1839-their surroundings honestly . [Other houses in [the neighborhood]1841-the neighborhood]1840-other houses in the neighborhood had been built by [expensive architects]1842-expensive architects , over others [[their]1842-expensive architects inmates]1843-their inmates had fidgeted sedulously , yet all these suggested the accidental , the temporary ; while [Windy Corner]6-windy corner seemed as inevitable as an ugliness of Nature 's own creation . [One]2092-one might laugh at [the house]884-the house , but [one]2092-one never shuddered . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe was bicycling over this Monday afternoon with a piece of gossip . [He]119-mr. beebe had heard from [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans . [These admirable ladies]1847-these admirable ladies , since [they]1847-these admirable ladies could not go to [Cissie Villa]209-cissie villa , had changed [their]1847-these admirable ladies plans . [They]1847-these admirable ladies were going to [Greece]97-greece instead .

" Since [Florence]14-florence did [[my]146-miss alan poor sister]3316-my poor sister so much good , "[146-miss alan] wrote [Miss Catharine]146-miss alan , " [we]3317-we do not see why [we]3317-we should not try [Athens]38-athens this winter . Of course , [Athens]38-athens is a plunge , and [the doctor]3318-the doctor has ordered [her]3316-my poor sister special digestive bread ; but , after all , [we]3317-we can take that with [us]3317-we , and it is only getting first into [a steamer]3319-a steamer and then into [a train]3320-a train . But is there [an English Church]3321-an english church ? "[146-miss alan] And the letter went on to say : " [I]146-miss alan do not expect [we]3317-we shall go any further than [Athens]38-athens , but if [you]119-mr. beebe knew of [a really comfortable pension at [Constantinople]98-constantinople]3322-a really comfortable pension at constantinople , [we]3317-we should be so grateful . "[146-miss alan]

[Lucy]116-lucy would enjoy this letter , and the smile with which [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe greeted [Windy Corner]6-windy corner was partly for [her]116-lucy . [She]116-lucy would see the fun of it , and some of its beauty , for [she]116-lucy must see some beauty . Though [she]116-lucy was hopeless about pictures , and though [she]116-lucy dressed so unevenly -- oh , that cerise frock yesterday at [church!--she]1848-church!--she must see some beauty in life , or [she]116-lucy could not play the piano as [she]116-lucy did . [He]119-mr. beebe had a theory that [musicians]1849-musicians are incredibly complex , and know far less than [other artists]1850-other artists what [they]1849-musicians want and what [they]1849-musicians are ; that [they]1849-musicians puzzle [themselves]1849-musicians as well as [[their]1849-musicians friends]1851-their friends ; that [their]1849-musicians psychology is a modern development , and has not yet been understood . This theory , had [he]119-mr. beebe known it , had possibly just been illustrated by facts . Ignorant of the events of yesterday [he]119-mr. beebe was only riding over to get some tea , to see [[his]119-mr. beebe niece]1364-his niece , and to observe whether [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy saw anything beautiful in the desire of [two old ladies]1853-two old ladies to visit [Athens]38-athens .

[A carriage]1854-a carriage was drawn up outside [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , and just as [he]119-mr. beebe caught sight of [the house]884-the house [it]1854-a carriage started , bowled up [the drive]1789-the drive , and stopped abruptly when [it]1854-a carriage reached [the main road]1857-the main road . Therefore it must be the horse , who always expected [people]308-people to walk up [the hill]894-the hill in case [they]308-people tired [him]119-mr. beebe . The door opened obediently , and [two men]1860-two men emerged , whom [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe recognized as [Cecil]198-cecil and [Freddy]124-freddy . [They]1860-two men were [an odd couple]1861-an odd couple to go driving ; but [he]119-mr. beebe saw a trunk beside [the coachman]1257-the coachman 's legs . [Cecil]198-cecil , who wore a bowler , must be going away , while [Freddy]124-freddy ( a cap)--was seeing [him]119-mr. beebe to [the station]1628-the station . [They]1860-two men walked rapidly , taking the short cuts , and reached the summit while [the carriage]869-the carriage was still pursuing the windings of [the road]409-the road .

[They]1860-two men shook hands with [the clergyman]335-the clergyman , but did not speak .

" So [you]198-cecil 're off for a minute , [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse ? "[335-the clergyman] [he]335-the clergyman asked .

[Cecil]198-cecil said , " Yes , "[198-cecil] while [Freddy]124-freddy edged away .

" [I]335-the clergyman was coming to show [you]198-cecil this delightful letter from [those friends of [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy]3323-those friends of miss honeychurch . "[335-the clergyman] [He]335-the clergyman quoted from it . " Is n't it wonderful ? Is n't it romance ? Most certainly [they]3323-those friends of miss honeychurch will go to [Constantinople]98-constantinople . [They]3323-those friends of miss honeychurch are taken in a snare that can not fail . [They]3323-those friends of miss honeychurch will end by going round [the world]2106-the world . "[335-the clergyman]

[Cecil]198-cecil listened civilly , and said [he]198-cecil was sure that [Lucy]116-lucy would be amused and interested .

" Is n't Romance capricious ! And , [Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett not favouring the scheme , [they]1893-we walked up [the hill]894-the hill in a silence which was only broken by [the rector]1348-the rector naming some fern . On [the summit]1896-the summit [they]1893-we paused . The sky had grown wilder since [he]1348-the rector stood [there]337-there last hour , giving to [the land]1898-the land a tragic greatness that is rare in [Surrey]29-surrey . Grey clouds were charging across tissues of white , which stretched and shredded and tore slowly , until through their final layers there gleamed a hint of the disappearing blue . Summer was retreating . The wind roared , the trees groaned , yet the noise seemed insufficient for those vast operations in [heaven]2258-heaven . The weather was breaking up , breaking , broken , and it is a sense of the fit rather than of the supernatural that equips such crises with the salvos of angelic artillery . [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe 's eyes rested on [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , where [Lucy]116-lucy sat , practising Mozart . No smile came to [his]119-mr. beebe lips , and , changing the subject again , [he]119-mr. beebe said : " [We]1893-we sha n't have rain , but [we]1893-we shall have darkness , so let [us]1893-we hurry on . The darkness last night was appalling . "[119-mr. beebe]

[They]1893-we reached [the Beehive Tavern]3340-the beehive tavern at about five o'clock . [That amiable hostelry]1901-that amiable hostelry possesses [a verandah]1902-a verandah , in which [the young]1077-the young and [the unwise]1904-the unwise do dearly love to sit , while [guests of more mature years]1905-guests of more mature years seek [a pleasant sanded room]1906-a pleasant sanded room , and have tea at a table comfortably . " [They]3382-they that marry do well , but [they]3382-they that refrain do better . "[119-mr. beebe] So ran [his]119-mr. beebe belief , and [he]119-mr. beebe never heard that an engagement was broken off but with a slight feeling of pleasure . Chapter XIX : Lying to [Mr. Emerson

The Miss Alans]150-the miss alans were found in [[their]1944-they beloved temperance hotel near [Bloomsbury]104-bloomsbury]1945-their beloved temperance hotel near bloomsbury -- [a clean , airless establishment much patronized by [provincial England]1947-provincial england]1946-a clean , airless establishment much patronized by provincial england . [They]1944-they always perched [there]337-there before crossing [the great seas]1949-the great seas , and for a week or two would fidget gently over clothes , guide - books , mackintosh squares , digestive bread , and other Continental necessaries . That there are [shops abroad]1950-shops abroad , even in [Athens]38-athens , never occurred to [them]1944-they , for [they]1944-they regarded travel as a species of warfare , only to be undertaken by [those who have been fully armed at [the Haymarket Stores]1952-the haymarket stores]1951-those who have been fully armed at the haymarket stores . [Miss Honeychurch]116-lucy , [they]1944-they trusted , would take care to equip [herself]116-lucy duly . Quinine could now be obtained in tabloids ; paper soap was a great help towards freshening up [one]2092-one 's face in [the train]2588-the train . [Lucy]116-lucy promised , a little depressed .

" But , of course , [you]3393-you know all about these things , and [you]3393-you have [Mr. Vyse]200-mr. vyse to help [you]3393-you . [A gentleman]646-a gentleman is such [a stand - by]3395-a stand - by . "[116-lucy]

"[146-miss alan]

" Or does [his]200-mr. vyse work keep [him]200-mr. vyse in [London]1-london ? "[145-miss teresa] said [Miss Teresa]145-miss teresa , [the more acute and less kindly of [the two sisters]1958-the two sisters]1957-the more acute and less kindly of the two sisters .

" [No one]2143-no one will see [Lucy]116-lucy off , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] interposed [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch . " [She]116-lucy does n't like it . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" Really ? How funny ! [I]450-her mother should have thought that in this case-- "[450-her mother]

" Oh , [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , [you]154-mrs. honeychurch are n't going ? It is such a pleasure to have met [you]154-mrs. honeychurch ! "[450-her mother]

[They]1958-the two sisters escaped , and [Lucy]116-lucy said with relief : " That 's all right . [We]1958-the two sisters just got through that time . "[116-lucy]

But [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother was annoyed . " [I]450-her mother should be told , [dear]2102-dear , that [I]450-her mother am unsympathetic . [Lucy]116-lucy had plenty to say in reply . [She]116-lucy described [the Miss Alans]150-the miss alans ' character : [they]1960-i were such gossips , and if [one]2092-one told [them]1960-i , the news would be everywhere in no time .

" But why should n't it be everywhere in no time ? "[1960-i]

" Because [I]1960-i settled with [Cecil]198-cecil not to announce it until [I]1960-i left [England]13-england . [I]1960-i shall tell [them]1963-them then . It 's much pleasanter . How wet it is ! Let 's turn in [here]2087-here . "[1960-i]

" Here "[1960-i] was [the British Museum]1962-the british museum . [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch refused . If [they]1963-them must take shelter , let it be in [a shop]1964-a shop . [Lucy]116-lucy felt contemptuous , for [she]116-lucy was on the tack of caring for Greek sculpture , and had already borrowed a mythical dictionary from [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe to get up the names of the goddesses and gods .

" Oh , well , let it be [shop]3401-shop , then . Let 's go to [[Mudie]286-mudie 's]3402-mudie 's . [I]116-lucy 'll buy a guide - book . "[116-lucy]

" [You]116-lucy know , [Lucy]116-lucy , [you]116-lucy and [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett and [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe all tell [me]116-lucy [I]116-lucy 'm so stupid , so [I]116-lucy suppose [I]116-lucy am , but [I]116-lucy shall never understand this hole - and - corner work . [You]116-lucy 've got rid of [Cecil]198-cecil -- well and good , and [I]116-lucy 'm thankful [he]198-cecil 's gone , though [I]116-lucy did feel angry for the minute . But why not announce it ? Why this hushing up and tip - toeing ? "[116-lucy]

" It 's only for a few days . "[116-lucy]

" But why at all ? "[116-lucy]

[Lucy]116-lucy was silent . [She]116-lucy was drifting away from [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother . It was quite easy to say , " Because [George Emerson]118-george has been bothering [me]116-lucy , and if [he]118-george hears [I]116-lucy 've given up [Cecil]198-cecil may begin again"--quite[116-lucy] easy , and it had the incidental advantage of being true . But [she]116-lucy could not say it . [She]116-lucy disliked confidences , for they might lead to self - knowledge and to that king of terrors -- [Light]287-light . Ever since that last evening at [Florence]14-florence [she]116-lucy had deemed it unwise to reveal [her]116-lucy soul .

[Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch , too , was silent . [She]154-mrs. honeychurch was thinking , " [[My]154-mrs. honeychurch daughter]3129-my daughter wo n't answer [me]154-mrs. honeychurch ; [she]3129-my daughter would rather be with [those inquisitive old maids]3404-those inquisitive old maids than with [Freddy]124-freddy and [me]154-mrs. honeychurch . Any rag , tag , and bobtail apparently does if [she]3129-my daughter can leave [[her]3129-my daughter [home]381-home]839-her home . "[154-mrs. honeychurch] And as in [her]116-lucy case thoughts never remained unspoken long , [she]154-mrs. honeychurch burst out with : " [You]3407-you 're tired of [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

This was perfectly true . [Lucy]116-lucy had hoped to return to [Windy Corner]6-windy corner when [she]116-lucy escaped from [Cecil]198-cecil , but [she]116-lucy discovered that [[her]116-lucy home]839-her home existed no longer . It might exist for [Freddy]124-freddy , who still lived and thought straight , but not for one who had deliberately warped the brain . [She]116-lucy did not acknowledge that [her]116-lucy brain was warped , for the brain itself must assist in that acknowledgment , and [she]116-lucy was disordering the very instruments of life . [She]116-lucy only felt , " [I]116-lucy do not love [George]118-george ; [I]116-lucy broke off [my]116-lucy engagement because [I]116-lucy did not love [George]118-george ; [I]116-lucy must go to [Greece]97-greece because [I]116-lucy do not love [George]118-george ; it is more important that [I]116-lucy should look up gods in the dictionary than that [I]116-lucy should help [[my]116-lucy mother]2638-my mother ; [everyone else]1552-everyone else is behaving very badly . "[116-lucy] [She]116-lucy only felt irritable and petulant , and anxious to do what [she]116-lucy was not expected to do , and in this spirit [she]116-lucy proceeded with the conversation .

" Oh , [mother]2108-mother , what rubbish [you]2108-mother talk ! Of course [I]116-lucy 'm not tired of [Windy Corner]6-windy corner . "[116-lucy]

" Then why not say so at once , instead of considering half an hour ? "[116-lucy]

[She]116-lucy laughed faintly , " Half a minute would be nearer . "[116-lucy]

" Perhaps [you]2108-mother would like to stay away from [[your]2108-mother home]3411-your home altogether ? "[116-lucy]

" Hush , [mother]2108-mother ! [People]308-people will hear [you]116-lucy "[116-lucy] ; for [they]1967-they had entered [Mudie]286-mudie 's . [She]116-lucy bought [Baedeker]126-baedeker , and then continued : " Of course [I]126-baedeker want to live at [home]381-home ; but as [we]3415-we are talking about it , [I]126-baedeker may as well say that [I]126-baedeker shall want to be away in the future more than [I]126-baedeker have been . [You]450-her mother see , [I]126-baedeker come into [my]126-baedeker money next year . "[126-baedeker]

Tears came into [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother 's eyes .

Driven by nameless bewilderment , by what is in [older people]2250-older people termed " eccentricity , "[116-lucy] [Lucy]116-lucy determined to make this point clear . " [I]116-lucy 've seen [the world]2106-the world so little -- [I]116-lucy felt so out of things in [Italy]11-italy . [I]116-lucy have seen so little of life ; one ought to come up to [London]1-london more -- not a cheap ticket like to - day , but to stop . [I]116-lucy might even share [a flat]2627-a flat for a little with [some other girl]3418-some other girl . "[116-lucy]

" And mess with typewriters and latch - keys , "[154-mrs. honeychurch] exploded [Mrs. Honeychurch]154-mrs. honeychurch . " And agitate and scream , and be carried off kicking by [the police]2388-the police . And call it a Mission -- when [no one]2143-no one wants [you]450-her mother ! And call it Duty -- when it means that [you]450-her mother ca n't stand [[your]450-her mother own [home]381-home]3421-your own home ! And call it Work -- when [thousands of [men]2100-men]3423-thousands of men are starving with the competition as it is ! And then to prepare [yourself]450-her mother , find [two doddering old ladies]3425-two doddering old ladies , and go abroad with [them]3425-two doddering old ladies . "[154-mrs. honeychurch]

" [I]116-lucy want more independence , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy lamely ; [she]116-lucy knew that [she]116-lucy wanted something , and independence is a useful cry ; [we]1970-we can always say that [we]1970-we have not got it . [She]116-lucy tried to remember [her]116-lucy emotions in [Florence]14-florence : those had been sincere and passionate , and had suggested beauty rather than short skirts and latch - keys . But independence was certainly [her]116-lucy cue .

" Very well . Take [your]450-her mother independence and be gone . Rush up and down and round [the world]2106-the world , and come back as thin as a lath with the bad food . "[116-lucy]

[Lucy]116-lucy screwed up [her]116-lucy mouth and said : " Perhaps [I]116-lucy spoke hastily . "[116-lucy]

" More every moment . "[116-lucy]

" [I]116-lucy do n't know what [you]116-lucy mean , [mother]2108-mother ; [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett and [I]116-lucy are not the very least alike . "[116-lucy]

" What rubbish ! And if [you]116-lucy dislike [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett so , it 's rather a pity [you]116-lucy asked [her]115-miss bartlett to stop . [She]116-lucy and [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother shopped in silence , spoke little in [the train]2588-the train , little again in [the carriage]869-the carriage , which met [them]1975-they at [Dorking Station]106-dorking station . It had poured all day and as [they]1975-they ascended through [the deep Surrey lanes]1976-the deep surrey lanes showers of water fell from the over - hanging beech - trees and rattled on the hood . [Lucy]116-lucy complained that the hood was stuffy . Leaning forward , [she]116-lucy looked out into the steaming dusk , and watched the carriage - lamp pass like a search - light over mud and leaves , and reveal nothing beautiful . " The crush when [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett gets in will be abominable , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy remarked . So [the Emersons]143-the emersons had gone , and all this bother about [Greece]97-greece had been unnecessary . Waste ! That word seemed to sum up the whole of life . Wasted plans , wasted money , wasted love , and [she]116-lucy had wounded [[her]116-lucy mother]450-her mother . Was it possible that [she]116-lucy had muddled things away ? Quite possible . [Other people]3350-other people had . When [the maid]2625-the maid opened the door , [she]2625-the maid was unable to speak , and stared stupidly into [the hall]1804-the hall .

[Miss Bartlett]115-miss bartlett at once came forward , and after a long preamble asked a great favour : might [she]116-lucy go to [church]532-church ? This was a stained window , through which some feeble light was shining , and when the door opened [Lucy]116-lucy heard [Mr. Beebe]119-mr. beebe 's voice running through the litany to [a minute congregation]1992-a minute congregation . [She]116-lucy followed [the maid]2625-the maid into [the Rectory]2109-the rectory .

Somehow it was impossible to cheat [this old man]2021-this old man . [She]2020-she shook [her]2020-she head .

" Take [an old man]520-an old man 's word ; there 's nothing worse than a muddle in all [the world]2106-the world . It is easy to face Death and Fate , and the things that sound so dreadful . It is on [my]2028-you muddles that [I]2028-you look back with horror -- on the things that [I]2028-you might have avoided . [We]3503-we can help [one another]2289-one another but little . [She]116-lucy summoned physical disgust .

[Lucy]116-lucy began to cry with anger , and though [her]116-lucy anger passed away soon , [her]116-lucy tears remained .

" [I]2030-i only wish [poets]3517-poets would say this , too : love is of the body ; not the body , but of the body . [Ah]3518-ah ! the misery that would be saved if [we]3519-we confessed that ! Chapter XX : The End of the Middle Ages

[The Miss Alans]150-the miss alans did go to [Greece]97-greece , but [they]2046-they went by [themselves]2046-they . [They]2046-they alone of [this little company]2047-this little company will double [Malea]107-malea and plough [the waters of [the Saronic gulf]2049-the saronic gulf]2048-the waters of the saronic gulf . [They]2046-they alone will visit [Athens]38-athens and [Delphi]101-delphi , and either shrine of intellectual song -- that upon [the Acropolis]2050-the acropolis , encircled by [blue seas]2051-blue seas ; [that under [Parnassus]108-parnassus , where the eagles build and the bronze charioteer drives undismayed towards infinity]2052-that under parnassus , where the eagles build and the bronze charioteer drives undismayed towards infinity . Trembling , anxious , cumbered with much digestive bread , [they]2046-they did proceed to [Constantinople]98-constantinople , [they]2046-they did go round [the world]2106-the world . [The rest of [us]2055-us]2054-the rest of us must be contented with a fair , but a less arduous , goal . Italiam petimus : [we]2055-us return to [the Pension Bertolini]113-the bertolini .

[George]118-george said it was [[his]118-george old room]2056-his old room .

" No , it is n't , "[116-lucy] said [Lucy]116-lucy ; " because it is [the room [I]116-lucy had]3538-the room i had , and [I]116-lucy had [[[your]118-george father]3004-your father 's room]3540-your father 's room . [I]116-lucy forget why ; [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett made [me]116-lucy , for some reason . "[116-lucy]

[He]118-george knelt on the tiled floor , and laid [his]118-george face in [her]116-lucy lap .

" [George]118-george , [[you]118-george baby]3541-you baby , get up . "[118-george]

" Why should n't [I]118-george be [a baby]2283-a baby ? "[118-george] murmured [George]118-george .

Unable to answer this question , [she]116-lucy put down [his]118-george sock , which [she]116-lucy was trying to mend , and gazed out through the window . It was evening and again the spring .

" Oh , bother [Charlotte]115-miss bartlett , "[116-lucy] [she]116-lucy said thoughtfully . " What can [such people]3543-such people be made of ? "[116-lucy]

" Same stuff as parsons are made of . "[118-george]

" Nonsense ! "[116-lucy]

" Quite right . It is nonsense . "[118-george]

" Now [you]118-george get up off the cold floor , or [you]118-george 'll be starting rheumatism next , and [you]118-george stop laughing and being so silly . "[116-lucy]

" What 's there to cry at ? Kiss [me]118-george here . "[118-george] [He]118-george indicated the spot where a kiss would be welcome .

[He]118-george was [a boy]2639-a boy after all . When it came to the point , it was [she]116-lucy who remembered the past , [she]116-lucy into whose soul the iron had entered , [she]116-lucy who knew whose room this had been last year . " Any letters ? "[118-george] [he]118-george asked .

" Just a line from [Freddy]124-freddy . "[2331-the cab - driver]

" Now kiss [me]2331-the cab - driver here ; then here . "[2331-the cab - driver]

Then , threatened again with rheumatism , [he]118-george strolled to the window , opened it ( as the English will ) , and leant out . There was the parapet , there [the river]410-the river , there to the left [the beginnings of [the hills]620-the hills]2059-the beginnings of the hills . [The cab - driver]2331-the cab - driver , who at once saluted [him]118-george with the hiss of a serpent , might be [that very Phaethon who had set this happiness in motion twelve months ago]2062-that very phaethon who had set this happiness in motion twelve months ago . A passion of gratitude -- all feelings grow to passions in [the South]10-the south -- came over [the husband]2063-the husband , and [he]118-george blessed [the people]2265-the people and the things who had taken so much trouble about [a young fool]2065-a young fool . [He]118-george had helped [himself]118-george , it is true , but how stupidly !

All the fighting that mattered had been done by [others]2278-others -- by [Italy]11-italy , by [[his]118-george father]350-his father , by [[his]118-george wife]2452-his wife .

" [Lucy]116-lucy , [you]116-lucy come and look at the cypresses ; and [the church]2115-the church , whatever [its]2115-the church name is , still shows . "[2278-others]

" [San Miniato]24-san miniato . [I]2452-his wife 'll just finish [your]116-lucy sock . "[2452-his wife]

" [Signorino]289-signorino , [domani faremo uno]3545-domani faremo uno giro , "[2069-the cabman] called [the cabman]2069-the cabman , with engaging certainty .

[George]118-george told [him]2069-the cabman that [he]118-george was mistaken ; [they]2070-i had no money to throw away on driving .

And [the people who had not meant to help]2071-the people who had not meant to help -- [the Miss Lavishes]290-the miss lavishes , [the Cecils]291-the cecils , [the Miss Bartletts]292-the miss bartletts ! Ever prone to magnify Fate , [George]118-george counted up the forces that had swept [him]118-george into this contentment .

" Anything good in [Freddy]124-freddy 's letter ? "[2070-i]

" Not yet . "[2070-i]

[His]118-george own content was absolute , but [hers]2072-hers held bitterness : [the Honeychurches]207-the honeychurches had not forgiven [them]2070-i ; [they]2070-i were disgusted at [her]2072-hers past hypocrisy ; [she]2072-hers had alienated [Windy Corner]6-windy corner , perhaps for ever .

" What does [he]124-freddy say ? "[2070-i]

" [Silly boy]3546-silly boy ! [He]124-freddy thinks [he]124-freddy 's being dignified . [He]124-freddy knew [we]3547-us should go off in the spring -- [he]124-freddy has known it for six months -- that if [mother]2108-mother would n't give [her]2108-mother consent [we]3547-us should take the thing into [our]3547-us own hands . [They]2070-i had fair warning , and now [he]124-freddy calls it an elopement . Ridiculous boy-- "[2070-i]

" [Signorino]289-signorino , [domani faremo uno]3549-domani faremo uno giro-- "[2070-i]

" But it will all come right in the end . [He]124-freddy has to build [us]3547-us both up from the beginning again . " [You]2070-i may well wish that . "[2070-i]

" [He]124-freddy will never forgive [us]3547-us -- [I]2070-i mean , [he]124-freddy will never be interested in [us]3547-us again . "[2070-i]

" Perhaps . "[2073-he] Then [he]2073-he said more gently : " Well , [I]2073-he acted the truth -- the only thing [I]2073-he did do -- and [you]2075-you came back to [me]2073-he . [Youth]801-youth enwrapped [them]801-youth ; the song of [Phaethon]180-phaethon announced passion requited , love attained . But [they]801-youth were conscious of a love more mysterious than this .
